characters: "THEY WANT US TO GROW UP A BIT AND
HERE/I GUESS THEYVE BEEN HERE AWHILE/ THEYVE LEFT US ALON
THE SPIRES ARE CONNECTED. IT IS ALL ONE. THE NTI ARK.
LIKE A GREAT SHADOW, RISES FROM THE DEPTHS BENEATH THE SH
BUT YOU KNOW I HAD TO COME.
"VIRGIL BRIGMAN BACK ON THE AIR/HAVE SOME NEW FRIENDS DOW
WHAT KIND OF PLAN IS THAT
BUT IT BOTHERS THEM TO SEE US HURTING EACH OTHER/GETTING
SPIRES FORM A PERFECT RING A MILE ACROSS. A VAST DARK FO
BETWEEN DEEPCORE AND EXPLORER BRIDGE DURING THE
IT'S ON ITS WAY TO YOU
BUD, PICK UP THE TOPSIDE LINE URGENT.
WE KNEW THIS WAS A ONE WAY TICKET WHEN I PUT THIS THING O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue, deep and featureless, the twilight of five hundred  feet down. PROPELLER SOUND.  Materializing out of the blue limbo is enormous but sleek form of an Ohio-class SSBN ballistic  missile submarine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the attack center, darkened to womb-red, the crew's fa shine with sweat in the glow of their instruments.  The  SKIPPER and his EXEC crowd around BARNES, the sonarman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty knots?  No way, Barnes... the  reds don't have anything that fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checked it twice, skipper.  It's a  real unique signature.  No cavitation,  no reactor noise...  doesn't even  sound like screws. He puts the signal onto a speaker and everyone in the att room listens to the intruder's acoustic signature, a stra THRUMMING.  The captain studies the electronic position b a graphic representation of the contours of the steep-wal canyon, a symbol for the Montana, and converging with it, amorphous trace, representing the bogey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what it's not, it's  not one of ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir!  Contact changing heading to  two-one-four, diving.  Speed eighty  knots!  Eighty knots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty knots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still diving, depth nine hundred  feet.  Port clearance to cliff wall,  one hundred fifty feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still diving, depth nine hundred  feet.  Port clearance to cliff wall,  one hundred fifty feet. Tension builds in the attack room as the Montana surges t intercept theY intruder.  The exec tensely watches the ve graphic readout for the side-scan sonar array.  The sub i running uncomfortably close to the cliff walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, to Captain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting tight in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can still give him a haircut.   Helm, come right to oh six niner,  down five degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming right to oh six niner, sir.   Down five degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Port side clearance one hundred twenty  feet narrowing to seventy-five.   Sir, we have a proximity warning  light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too damn close!  We've gotta  back off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Range to contact, two hundred.   Contact junked to bearing two six oh  and accelerated to... one hundred  thirty knots, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really freaked now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing goes one thirty! Suddenly the control room lights dim almost to blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see only the effect, not the source, as a large diffus light passes rapidly under the sub's hull.  Moments later shockwave, like an underwater sonic boom, impacts the sub slamming it sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge crew are knocked off their feet, as the ship i buffeted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turbulence!  We're in its wake! SIRENS.  Everyone shouting at once.  The power flickers l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helm, all stop!  Full right rudder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All stop.  Full right rudder.   Hydraulic failure.  Planes are not  responding, sir! Power returns in time for the sonarman to get a glimpse a the side-scan display... AS THE SHEER CLIFF WALL LOOM BEF THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hydraulics restored, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cliff wall materializes out of the blue limbo off the port bow with nightmarish slow-motion.  The sub slams int it with horrific force, scraping along and bouncing off. One tail stabilizer is sheared off and the big screw pran the wall with an earsplitting K-K-KWANG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the outer tube-doors torn off, seawater slams in, bu the inner hatches.  Two-foot thick columns of water, like fire-hoses of the gods, blast into the room.  Everything  vanishes instantly in white spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is hurled off his feet.  The planesman flights t recover control of the yoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collision alarm!  Collision alarm!   Lighten her up, Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The torpedo room is flooded, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow all tanks!  Blow everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing twelve hundred feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blowing main tanks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve hundred fifty feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great sub is being hauled down by the mass of its flo bow section, its flanks rushing past us like a freight tr headed for Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The command crew fights futilely for control, everyone  shouting and terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main forward tanks ruptured!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing thirteen hundred feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too deep to pump auxiliaries!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All back full!  All back full!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answering all back full.  Passing  thirteen hundred fifty feet...  fourteen hundred... fourteen fifty... The Captain locks eyes with the Exec amid the din...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing her.  Launch the buoy! The Exec opens the door to a small box and punches a butt A red light comes on.  The Captain takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny transmitter is ejected from the sub's hell and beg its long ascent to the surface.  A second later the sub s down like a piledriver onto a ledge, tearing open its pre hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS QUICK CUTS, just flashes and impressions, as... Seawater blasts down the corridors -- Explodes across the control room, hurling men like dolls Floods the cavernous missile bay in seconds -- Bursts through hatches into the reactor room -- Blasts men OUT OF FRAME in a micro-second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cobalt twilight we see the Montana slide down the cliff, its hull SCREECHING like the death agonies of some marine dinosaur.  Descending in an avalanche of silt, it  finally disappears into the blackness below... a blacknes which continues almost straight down, 20,000 feet to the  bottom of the Cayman Trough.  The abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above, in the world, the Caribbean rolling gray under a s sky.  The Montana's emergency buoy pops to the surface,  transmitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG LENS SHOT: three massive Navy Sea King helicopters  thundering straight at us, FILLING FRAME. REVERSE, as they barrel OVER CAMERA toward a lone civilia ship... an ugly but very sophisticated deep-sea drilling  support ship, the BENTHIC EXPLORER. It is a twin-hulled monstrosity with a central opening in its deck, around which crouch enormous cranes, winches an other arcane equipment. The first Sea King settles onto the helipad, disgorging a contingent of Naval officers, technicians, and a squad of armed seamen.  A pantomime in the rotorwash, we see the  Benthic Petroleum "company man" KIRKHILL greeting COMMODO DEMARCO, the on-scene commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge is state-of-the-art, with computers and  sophisticated navigation and communications gear, looking
like mission control with its bank of video monitors.  Th Drilling Operations Supervisor, LELAND MCBRIDE, and BENDI the crew chief, watch the invaders swarming the deck belo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does not look good at all. TIGHT ON VIDEO SCREEN (MINUTES LATER) showing divers work in total blackness around some sort of installation on th bottom of the ocean.  They move through the harsh floodli in dreamlike slow motion, looking like space-suited figur with their helmets and umbilical hoses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No light from the surface.  How deep  are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen hundred feet. WIDER, showing the Navy contingent crowding the control r DeMarco is hardcore military, brusque and efficient.  Kir is a small man with pinched features, wearing a shirt and tie, which on a drill ship means company man and/or dickh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need them to go to over two  thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can do it. (to McBride)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Brigman on the line.

dialogues.speaker: DAY, (TOTAL DARKNESS)
dialogues.text: 1700 FEET BELOW.  A submersible oil-drilling platform,  DEEPCORE II, an island of light in the vast blackness.  I main framework connects two "tri-modules" consisting of t cylinders each.  These contain living and work areas in a pressurized environment.  An umbilical cable, thick as a  man's thigh, runs up from the oil rig into the darkness, the Benthic Explorer at the surface.  In a bubble-like do port window we see the rig foreman, or "toolpusher," BUD  BRIGMAN.  He's talking (via headset) with two divers work outside... 'CATFISH' DE VRIES, AND LEW 'BIRD-DOG' FINLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys are milking that job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Kentucky drawl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cause we love freezin' our  butts off out here sooo much, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud turns from the window and crosses the drill floor.  T working heart of the rig.  THUNDEROUS MECHANICAL ROAR.  T drill crew, in hardhats and mud-plastered overalls, tend massive spinning turn-table in the center of the chamber. The semi-automated system requires only five men to opera The others are LUPTON MCWHIRTER, DWIGHT PERRY, JAMMER WIL and TOMMY RAY DIETZ.  Bud hears his names called above th din by Jammer, a massive roughneck/diver who stands a goo head taller than the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud!  Hippy's on the bitch-box.   It's a call from topside.  That new  company man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirkhill?  That guy doesn't know his  butt from a rathole.  Hey, Perry! One of the roustabouts, a wiry Texan, turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor and square away the  mud hose and those cable slings.   This place is starting to look like  my apartment. Perry chuckles and sets to the task cheerfully.  Bud EXIT ducking his head through a low watertight hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud tromps down the narrow corridor, his work boots gongi on steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming.  Keep your pantyhose on. He enters his office, a tiny cubicle with stacks of paper dust-gathering tech manuals and waterstained Penthouse fo outs.  He picks up the phone... punches down a line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brigman here.  Kirkhill?  What's  going on? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am calm.  I'm a calm person.  Is  there some reason why I shouldn't be  calm? HOLD ON Bud's expression, darkening, as he listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The control module is a long narrow cabin like the inside a Winnebago, packed with instrumentation.  At the end is small bay with multiple viewports.  Outside, at a 'Christ tree' pipe installation, a lone diver can be seen welding He is accompanied by a large submersible, FLATBED, and by Remotely Operated Vehicle, or ROV, call LITTLE GEEK.  Lit Geek is an underwater robot which operated on the end of cable-like control TETHER. It has a single video 'eye' in front, by which the operat pilots the little machine.  The rig's ROV pilots is ALLEN 'HIPPY' CARNES, who stands by the window twiddling his  joysticks and drinking coffee.  His pet white rat, BEANY, crawls contentedly around his shoulders.  The door BANGS  OPEN. Hippy jumps, slops his coffee.  Bud strides in.  Not calm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. He kicks a chair out of the way and slams his palm down o switch marked DIVER RECALL.  A SIREN, blasting through th water from a big hydrophone loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All divers.  Drop what you're doing.   Everybody out of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flatbed's pilot, LISA 'ONE NIGHT' STANDING, can be clearl seen behind a bubble canopy.  She is a no-nonsense lady w holds her own in the mostly male environment by being one the best submersible drivers in the business.  She contro a hydraulic manipulator arm, assisting the diver, ARLISS  'SONNY' DAWSON, in his work.  Little Geek hovers around t like a tiny helicopter.  One Night moves the Flatbed arm Sonny and hands him the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, hon'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in time, sugar. They react to Bud's recall, looking toward him up in the  control module.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, we just got out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a time when I would have  asked why. One Night makes a grab for his butt with the manipulator  claw, which he narrowly avoids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flatbed moves underneath the rig, a few feet above the  seafloor, with Sonny riding on its top deck.  It passes u a lit opening and rises toward the surface of the water i the chamber above.  Little Geek follows like an obedient  dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opening is called the moonpool, and Deepcore's  submersibles are launched through it.  From inside the su bay it looks just like a swimming pool. Flatbed surfaces, nearly filling it.  The chamber also  contains CAB ONE, a similar submersible.  Jammer, Perry, some of the other drill-room boys are helping the divers of the water.  The water at this depth is only about six  degrees above freezing, and these folks are cold and prun fingered.  Finler pulls off his demand-helmet, revealing round, boyish face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on?  How come we got  recalled?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell if I know. One Night jumps 'ashore' from Flatbed's broad deck and jo them.  Catfish is unzipping his bulky dry-suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just follow standard procedure, will  ya...  flog the dog till somebody  tells us what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Catfish, I'll sell you my October  Penthouse for twenty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save your money, darlin'... the pages  are all stuck together by now. Bud enters, approaching the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on, Boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks, I've just been told to shut  down the hole and prepare to move  the rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She-hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being asked to cooperate in a  matter of national security.  Now  you know exactly as much as I do.   So just get your gear off and get up  to control.  There's some kind of  briefing in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole rig crew is somehow jammed into the room for th video briefing. DeMarco is on the main monitor, with his aides and Kirkhi visible b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 09:22 local time this morning, an  American nuclear submarine, the USS  Montana, with 156 men aboard, went  down 22 miles from here.  There has  been no contact with the sub since  then.  The cause of the incident is  not known. PAN AROUND the reactions of the various drill crew member shocked, hushed, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your company has authorized the Navy's  use of this facility for a rescue  operation.  The code name is Operation  Salvor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want us to search for the sub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We know where it is.  But she's  in 2000 feet of water and we can't  reach her.  We need divers to enter  the sub and search for survivors, if  any. Bud's scowl has been deepening since DeMarco started to t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you guys have your own stuff  for this type of thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time we get our rescue  submersible here the storm front  will be right on us.  But you can  get your rig in under the storm and  be on-site in fifteen hours.  That  makes you our best option right now. Hippy, born suspicious and recently graduated to paranoid leans forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should we risk our butts on a  job like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have been authorized to offer you  all special-duty bonuses equivalent  to three times normal dive pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, for triple time I'd crawl  through razor blades and shower off  with lime juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to tell ya', you could set  me on fire and call me names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know what kind of a  deal you guys worked out with the  company, but my people are not  qualified for this... they're oil  workers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A four-man SEAL team will transfer  down to you to supervise the  operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can send down whoever you like,  but I'm the toolpusher on this rig,  and when it comes to the safety of  these people, there's me... then  there's God.  Understand?  If things  get dicey, I'm pulling the plug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're all on the same  wavelength, Brigman.  Now let's get  the wellhead uncoupled, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud stands beside the hatchway as the others file out tow their tasks. They comment gravely as they pass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Lindsey finds out about this,  it's not gonna be a pretty sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to have to shoot her  with a tranquilizer gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single Navy Sea King churns through the rain under mass thunderheads. The sea below is whipped by the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANNING ALONG BOOTED FEET, four pairs of black military s twelves line up, onto... a pair of Charles Jourdans fives under shapely ankles. WIDER, revealing the four-man team of Navy SEALs.  And a  slender woman in her early thirties.  She's attractive, i bit hardened, dressed conservatively in a skirt and jacke Meet LINDSEY.  Project Engineer for Deepcore.  She's a pa in the ass, but you'll like her.  Eventually. She's holding on grimly, sitting crammed in with the SEAL and a bunch of gear, getting tossed around by the storm. The SEALs are dressed alike in black fatigues.  They are  muscular, finely-tuned and extremely dangerous special-fo types.  The leader of the SEAL team, LIEUTENANT COFFEY, m his way forward to the cockpit. The pilot is white-knuckling his stick, trying to hold th great beast of a helicopter in position.  Through the  windshield, the deck of the Benthic Explorer can be seen  below, pitching in a violent sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way I'm putting her down.  I  shouldn't even be flying in this  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold it over the deck. Coffey goes back to the crew deck, moving easily in the  bucking craft.  He nods to the others SEALs, MONK, WILHIT and SCHOENICK.  In the open side door, Wilhite clips a 10 foot nylon rope to the airframe and throws out the coil. One by one the shoulder the gear-bags, grab the rope, and step out. Lindsey stands swaying in the chopper door, watching the  SEALs fast-roping to the deck.  One, two, three.  Coffey  looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to be on that ship, there's  only one way it's going to happen. He's sure she won't go for it.  It's his certainty that g her.  She sets her jaw.  Opening her purse she takes out small plastic bag, puts her shoes and purse in the bag, a grips the bag in her teeth.  Then grabs the rope and slid down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swinging wildly in the wind like a human pendulum, Lindse fast-ropes forty feet to the deck.  She steps away an ins before Coffey hits behind her. Lindsey crosses the rainswept deck with athletic strides. Her nylons are ruined.  An air-crewman in the chopper low two additional equipment cases using the rescue sling.  T SEALs catch them as they swing radically across the deck. They Navy chopper banks and seems to scurry away before t mounting storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACKNESS.  Then shafts of light become visible, above a  ridge of rock. Flatbed appears, trailing two heavy two cables.  Behind i the mass of Deepcore emerges from the darkness, its forwa lighting array blazing. Flatbed is towing it like a tug, aided by Deepcore's own  mighty stern thrusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, his feet propped up, uses joystick controls to 'fly' Deepcore, maneuvering against currents and around seafloo obstacles.  He is guided by the side-scan sonar display,  with Hippy assisting in the sonar shack. Through the front viewport, Flatbed can be seen out ahead McBride appears on the bridge monitor, holding a sheet of weather-fax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's official, sportsfans.   They're calling it Hurricane  Frederick, and it's going to be making  our lives real interesting in a few  hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud responds via video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, huh?  I don't know.  Hurricanes  should be named after women.
McBride looks up as the bridge door opens.  Lindsey enter in a blast of wind, wet as a wharf rat and twice as pisse off.  Maybe Bud is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is surprised to see Lindsey's face appear on the moni screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you let them do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unpreturbed, almost  cheerful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Lins.  I thought you were in  Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was, but I managed to bum a ride  on the last flight out here.  Only  here isn't where I left it, is it,  Bud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't up to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were that close to proving a  submersible drilling platform could  work.  We had over seven thousand  feet of hole down for Chrissake.  I  can't believe you let them grab my  rig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your rig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My rig.  I designed the damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup, and Benthic Petroleum paid for  it.  So as long as they're hold the  pink slip, I go where they tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wimp.  I had a lot riding on  this.  They bought you... more like  least rented you cheap--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm switching off now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgil, you wiener!  You never could  stand up to fight.  You-- Bud hits the switch and the screen goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. Hippy looks over him, trying very hard not to crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I hate that bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you never should have  married her then. Bud nods fatalistically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten foot waves crash through the launch-well, sending up  geysers of spray. Next to the launch-well, crewman have attached a lifting  cable to CAB THREE, eighteen feet of ugly yellow submersi It slams violently in its steel cradle as the drill-ship  rolls.  Coffey and Schoenick hand the gear bags in to Wil and Monk though the hatch under the rear of the submersib Lindsey approaches, wearing a borrowed roustabout's cover She looks down at the larger of the two equipment cases  brought by the SEALs, lying on the deck.  Stenciled on it are the words: F.B.S./DEEP SUIT/MARK IV. Coffey and Schoenick push past her to pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, gentlemen!  We either launch  now or we don't launch. Coffey looks up in surprise as she nimbly climbs the side Cab Three and grabs the lifting shackle, circling her rai hand to signal the crane man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her up, Byron! Cab Three, with Lindsey riding its back, is pulled up out its cradle and starts to swing violently as Explorer pitc The submersible is then swung out to the center of the la well.  It sways and gyrates above the furious water below Lindsey drops into the upper hatch. 33   INT. EXPLORER BRIDGE/D.O.C. Kirkhill leans suddenly over the console to look out the  window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is she doing out there?   Son of a bitch... (into microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey... get out of Cab Three.   Bates is taking her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey pulls her headset as she dogs down the inside loc levers of the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bates is sick.  Besides I've got  more hours in this thing than he  does. (to Coffey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little change of plan. The little sub is swinging like a pendulum on the cable, the SEALs, jammed in with their equipment in the tiny spa are getting slammed into the walls.  Lindsey is calmly  flipping switches as she talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, we better fish or cut bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold your water, okay? (to Kirkhill)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Kirkhill, we gonna do this or we  gonna talk about it? 35   INT. EXPLORER BRIDGE/D.O.C. The plug is pulled on DeMarco's patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care who drives the damn  thing.  Just get my team in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright.  Christ Almighty! He gestured dismissively to McBride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cab Three, you are clear to launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey reaches up a grabs a red lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger. (to Coffey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one way it's going to  happen... She pulls the lever hard.  CLUNK-CLANG!  The shackle-rele drops the sub. It freefalls ten feet to the water with an enormous splas and keeps right on going after Lindsey floods the trim ta Coffey et al have been slammed hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touchdown.  The crowd goes wild.   Explorer... Cab Three.  We are  styling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Cab Three. Lindsey cuts on the floodlights and maneuvers the descend submersible so that the umbilical cable is a few feet ahe on her front port.  Moving up through her lights, it will guide her down to the rig.  Cab Three free-falls into  increasing darkness.  Soon it is a candle below us in the indigo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Night is driving the tug one-handed, pouring coffee f a thermos and rocking out to the great truck-driving song "Willing" on the beat-box she's got propped up on the son rig.  Fighting white-line fever in the best tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud and Hippy come in for a rousing chorus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I've been driving every kinda  rig that's ever been maaaaade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit up like a proud Peterbilt, the rig crossed the trackl wastes.  We hear them singing, carried OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In total blackness, the submersible descends along the  rigorous line of the umbilical cable.  Two hundred feet b it, the lights of Deepcore resolve out of the darkness. we can see the rig crawling over the ocean bottom like so monster lawnmower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deepcore, Deepcore... this is Cab  Three on final approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha, Cab Three.  Who is that?   That You, Lindsey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud stop singing and snaps around at the mention of her n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None other. Bud's expression is nothing less than stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... you gotta be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey executes a 180 degree turn and cruises over the  control module, back through the A-frame toward the docki hatch.  The flange of Cab Three's lockout hatch settles o the pressure collar on the rig's back.  There is a CLUNK it mates up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey drops down from the hatch into the small cylindri pressure chamber. The SEALs drop down behind her, passing their gear throug hand-over-hand. The chamber is spartan, with steel benches, a folding car table, breathing masks, and medical supplies.  Catfish gr them through the tiny porthole at one end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, y'all.  Hey, Lindsey!  I'll  be damned!  You shouldn't be down  here sweet thing, ya'll might run ya  stockings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't stay away.  You running  mixture for us?  Good.  Couldn't ask  for better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here we go.  Start equalizing,  y'all. HISSSS of inrushing compressed gas.  The pressure in the  chamber rises.  The breathing mixture is composed of heli oxygen and nitrogen.  Catfish monitors it carefully from station outside the chamber, watching the gauges with a  practiced eye.  Lindsey and the SEALs all grab their nose and start making funny faces... popping their ears with t familiar diver's 'equalization' technique.  They continue as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get comfortable.  The bad news is we  got six hours in this can, blowing  down.  The worse news is it's gonna  take us three weeks to decompress  back to the surface later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been fully briefed, Mrs.  Brigman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me that, okay... I hate  that.  Alright, from now on we watch  each other closely for signs of  HPNS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if by rote)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High-Pressure Nervous Syndrome.   Muscle tremors, usually in the hands  first.  Nausea, increased  excitability, disorientation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good.  About one person in twenty  just can't handle it.  They go buggo.   They're no way to predict who's  susceptible, so stay alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we've all made chamber runs to  this depth.  We're checked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... chamber runs.  Uh huh, that's  good. (Coffey turn away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hey... you guys know any songs? They ignore her.  Start going over some diagrams of the  Montana's interior. It's going to be a long six hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish checks his watch, then reaches over and adjusts a value on the tri-mix manifold, watching the gauges.   Satisfied, he leans over to the pressure window in the do checking out the SEALs.  Hippy has come down from the con deck for an advanced look are the interlopers.  Jammer is a chair, reading a Louis L'Amour paperback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those guys ain't so tough.  I fought  plenty of guys tougher'n them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we get to hear about how he used  to be a contender. Catfish hold up one callused fist up in front of Hippy's  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see this?  They used to call  this the Hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy wasn't born then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like the end of a long bus trip.  Everyone silen leafing through beat-to-hell magazines or just staring.   Lindsey has her feet propped up on the smaller of the SEA two equipment cases.  She casually toes open one of the  latches, then the other.  Glances at Coffey.  He's readin She begins to lift the lid with her toe.  Gets a GLIMPSE  INSIDE, of packing foam, and what looks like a SMALL BLAC METAL BOX.  Then... WHAM!  Coffey's foot comes down on th lid, slamming it shut.  Startled, she looks up into his c gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curiosity killed the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON CATFISH'S hands... closing values... spinning th wheel on the chamber hatch.  CUT WIDER as it cracks open  with a virgin's sigh and swings aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all'er done to a turn and ready to  serve.  Everybody okay? The SEALs nod peremptorily and shoulder their gear.  Lind exits first, followed by Monk, Wilhite, and Schoenick.  C bends to relatch the small equipment case.  He is alone f one moment in the chamber.  He raises his hand and stares it.  The fingertips are trembling the slightest bit.  He  clenches them into a fist and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lindsey emerges into the main corridor of the rig, she bumps into a large, dark mass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, was there a wall here before?   I don't remember a wall here.  Oh,  Jammer!  Hi. The 'wall' grins down to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, there, little lady. Coffey emerges behind them and, ignoring Lindsey, faces  Jammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jammer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show us the dive prep area.  We need  to check out your gear. Jammer scowls, turns and leads the SEALs in the sub-bay. Catfish and Lindsey exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those guys are about a much fun as a  tax audit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON HIPPY, bathed in the light of the sonar display. He is making kissing sounds at Beany, who has his inquisi nose right up to Hippy's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy, you're going to give that rat  a disease. WIDER, as Hippy and Bud to see Lindsey leaning in the doo She and Bud size each other up.  He opts for a jovial  approach, his eyes wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well.  Mrs. Brigman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long. Lindsey crossed past him, her eyes scanning the banks of  equipment, almost unconsciously checking, checking... get the pulse of her big iron baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never did like being called that,  did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even when it meant something. (looking through the  front port)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that One Night up in Flatbed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else? Lindsey leans past Bud to the gooseneck mike on the conso

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, One Night, it's Lindsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Night mimes a puking motion, finger down her throat. Then she replies with sickening sweetness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Lindsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey fives the sonar shack the once-over.  She tweaks  some knobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you were dumb enough  to come down.  Now you're stuck here  for the storm...  dumb, hot-rod...  dumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I didn't come down here to  fight. She crosses past Bud and exits into the corridor.  Bud bo out of the chair to follow her and Hippy scrambles in to  take over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud catches up with Lindsey in the corridor, and through following keeps pace with here as she make here inspectio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why'd you come down? She stops abruptly to look at a leaky pipe.  He almost sl into her.  She moves on, climbing down the ladder to the  lower level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need me.  Nobody knows the systems  on this rig better than I do.  What  is something was to go wrong after  the Explorer clears off?  What would  you have done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you're right!  Us poor dumb ol'  boys might've had to think for  ourselves.  Coulda been a disaster. On the lower level landing, Lindsey opens a hatch into on of the machine rooms.  ROAR OF PUMPS AND COMPRESSORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey enters and moves expertly through the dark labyri of pipes and roaring machinery.  Her eyes rove constantly over fittings, gauges, circuit panels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna know what I think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not particularly.  Jeez, look where  this is set!  Morons.
She scowls at a pressure gauge and turn a valve minutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you were worried about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be it. Lindsey's on the move again, and Bud scrambles through th pipes to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think you were.  Come on, admit  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was worried about the rig.  I've  got over four years invested in this  project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, right... and you only had  three years with me. She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to have priorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness.  The door opens and Bud snaps on the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bunk's the only one I can guarantee  won't be occupied.  You can grab a  couple hours before we get there. Lindsey slips past him into his tiny state-room, the only private bunk on the rig.  Rank had its privileges.  His h on the door is just level with her eyes.  She notices his wedding ring, a massive band of pure titanium (something  your fiancee might have picked out if she had a degree fr M.I.T.).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you still wearing that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Divorce ain't final.   Forgot to take it off.
Bud stays in the doorway.  Lindsey takes a heaps of Bud's clothes off the narrow bunk.  Start unconsciously  straightening the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't worn mine in months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what's-his-name wouldn't like  it.  The Suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you always have to call him that?   The Suit?  It makes you sound like  such a hick.  His name is Michael. Lindsey takes off her borrowed tennies and socks. Bud eyes her, sounding too casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what about "Michael" then... Mr.  Brooks Brothers... Mr. BMW.  You  still seeing him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I haven't seen him in a few weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, why are you doing this?  It's  not part of you life any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what happened... you  woke up one day and realized the guy  never made you laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Bud.  It was just that  simple.  Aren't you clever?  You  should get your own show... Ask Dr.  Bud, advice to the lovelorn from  three hundred fathoms. She closes the watertight door, forcing him out.  Locks i She turns and throws her shoe hard against the far wall.

She flops down on the bed, sitting... staring at the wall Her armor is gone.  She looks small and vulnerable.  A lo beat.  She reaches over to the tiny sink.  Amid the clutt is a bottle of Bud's aftershave.  She unscrews it and tak a sniff.  Catches herself.  Tosses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud barges into the tiny head and puts some soap on his r finger.  He pulls the ring off roughly and throws it into the toilet.  He reaches forward to flush.  Can't do it. really pissed off at himself, he reaches into the toilet  bowl, wrist deep in the chemical-blue water, and salvages the ring. He puts it on and washes his hands.  The right hand stays faintly blue no matter how hard he scrubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The platform is stopped, hovering in place.  Like a great spacecraft setting own on a barren planet, the rig settle into the bottom ooze.  Flatbed releases its tow lines and heads back to its berth inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A PHOTOGRAPH, actually a computer-composited dow looking scan from a towed LIDAR (laser imaging sonar) rig It shows a faint, blurry outline of the Montana lying on side on a ledge part-way down the canyon wall.  There is detail.  A finger points to a flat ledge nearby.  An "X" been put on with a grease pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is us.  We're just on the edge  of the Cayman Trough.  The Montana  is here, on its side, 300 meters  away and 70 meters below us.  We  think she slid down the wall, and  lodged against this outcropping. CUT WIDE, showing the rig crew gathered around a worktabl in the sub-bay.

The divers, Bud, Catfish, Sonny, Finler, Jammer, and the  four SEALs have their dry-suits on.  The pre-dive briefin Lindsey, One Night, and Hippy will crew the submersibles. Wilhite is going around clipping DOSIMETER BADGES on  everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This tells us how much radiation we  get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, whoah...  I can't handle no  radiation, man.  Forget it!  Include  me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy, you pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good's the money if your dick  drops off in six months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take reading as we go.  If the  reactor's breached or the warheads  have released radioactive debris,  we'll back away.  Simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Hippy's not going...  McWhirter, you can run Little Geek. Bud pats the top of a small ROV, sitting next to its larg brother, Big Geek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way!  No way!  He can't fly an  ROV worth shit.  I'll go.  Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the dive, you will do absolutely  nothing without direct orders from  me, and you will follow my  instructions without discussion.  Is  this clear?  Alright, I want everyone  finished prep and ready to get wet  in fifteen minutes. The rig crew disperses, picking up helmets and diving gea Some are studying the diagrams of the Montana's interior  layout.  Bud takes Coffey aside as the others prepare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's three AM.  These guys are  running on bad coffee and four hours  sleep.  You better start cutting  them some slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't afford slack, Brigman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you come on my rig, you don't  talk to me, you start ordering my  guys around.  It won't work.  You  gotta know how to handle these  people... we have a certain way of  doing things here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in your way of  doing things.  Just get your team  ready to dive. End of discussion.  Coffey is walking away.  Burning, Bud crosses to his gear locker.  Picks up his helmet.  Finler suiting out next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you know your hand is blue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and get your gear on. NEARBY, Monk comes over to pick his helmet up off the  worktable.  Hippy points to the heavy equipment case that says F.B.S. DEEP SUIT/MARK IV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been meaning to ask you what  this thing is. Mink opens the case and shows them an unfamiliar diving s what looks like a space helmet, and a large backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluid breathing system.  We just got  them.  We use it if we need to go  really deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How deep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's classified... you know.  Anyway,  you breathe liquid, so you can't be  compressed.  Pressure doesn't get to  you. Catfish is grappling with the concept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying you get liquid in your  lungs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oxygenated fluorocarbon emulsion. Monk take a clear plastic box full of O-rings off the she and dumps them out.  He opens a valve on the backpack and allows some of the fluid inside it to drain into the box. Then he take Beany by the tail off Hippy's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out. He drops Beany in the box and, before Hippy can protest,  closes the lid. Beany is forced under the surface.  He struggled for a se and bubbles come out of his mouth.  Then he casually swim around in there, completely submerged... breathing liquid Catfish and the others stare into the box, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  He's diggin' it. Monk takes Beany out and hold him by the tail for a few  seconds to drain his lungs.  Then hands him back to Hippy The rat is annoyed, but otherwise alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no bullshit hands down the  goddamnedest thing I ever saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three sets of moving lights move outward from Deepcore. One and Three, with Lindsey and Hippy at the controls  respectively, and One Night in the Flatbed.  Lindsey is i the lead.
She approaches the cliff-like drop-off and starts to desc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Com-check, everybody.  Flatbed, you  on line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten-four, Lindsey, read you loud and  clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cab Three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cab Three, check.  Right behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going over the wall.  Coming to  bearing 065.  Everybody stay tight  and in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting out descent.  Divers, how're  you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight divers ride the back of Flatbed like itinerant work on the way to the fields.  Bud and his civilian crew, Cat Finler, and Jammer... sit across from the SEALs.  They ar in their gear and breathing from umbilical hooked in Flat low-pressure manifold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How deep's the drop-off here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This here's the bottomless pit, baby.   Two and a half miles straight down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock off the chatter.  Cab One, you  getting anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey consults her array of instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cab One, do you see it yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The magnetometer is pegged.  Side- scan is showing a big return, but I  don't see anything yet.  Are you  sure you got the depth right on this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be almost to it, ace. She turns the submersible and... The spotlight flares back from the great brass screw of t Montana.  It dwarfs Cab One, FILLING FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, roger that... uh, found  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cab One maneuvers along the flank of the enormous sub, wh Flatbed and Cab Three move above it.  Wilhite take readin with a hand-held neutron counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cab One, radiation readings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neutron counter's not showing very  much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilhite, anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative.  Nominal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just continue forward along the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that, continuing forward.  You  just want me to get shots of  everything, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, document as much as you can,  but keep moving.  We're on a tight  timeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that.

The great black hull of the Montana recedes into the dark beyond the puny beams of their lights.  It seems bigger t the Titanic and just as eerie in its final resting place. On it side, the sub's top deck becomes a wall along which the tiny submersibles are moving.  Ahead, in the lights, a white painted circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the midship hatch.  You see  it, Cab Three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, I see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get around so your lights are  on the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check.  Then I just hang with these  guys, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you want me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold above it.  Alright, A team. Wilhite, Schoenick, and Monk unhook their short whip- umbilicals from the central manifold and roll off the sid of Flatbed.  They maneuver down toward the sub's hatch.   Hippy guides Cab Three in closer to the hatch area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy turns to Perry back in the lockout chamber, ready t launch Little Geek. The ROV has a handheld neutron-counter gripped in its  manipulator arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by on the ROV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry, stand by on the ROV. (to Little Geek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about this, little buddy.   Better you than me, know what I mean?

Hippy nods and Perry drops Little Geek through the hatch  into the water and feed out a length of tether.  Hippy pi up the control box and watches the video screen, guiding ROV toward the Montana's hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three SEALs have unlatched the deck cover and reveale the hatch.  They open the out hatch and Monk swims down i to narrow escape trunk.  He bangs on the inner hatch with wrench, listening carefully with his helmet pressed again it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's flooded.  Alright, I'm opening  her up. Straining hard in the confined space, he get the lower ha open, then swims backs out immediately.  He gestures to H via Little Geek's vision, and Hippy flies the ROV into th hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile Cab One and Flatbed have proceeded forward alon the hull.  Beyond Lindsey's front port, the great hatches the Trident missile tubes roll toward us in procession.   Several of the hatch covers have been forced partway open the warping of the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radiation is nominal.  The warheads  must still be intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many are there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 Trident missiles.  Eight MIRVs  per missile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's 192 warheads... And how  powerful are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your MIRV is a tactical nuke, 50  kilotons nominal yield.  Say five  times Hiroshima.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... this is World War  Three in a can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's knock off the chatter, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON VIDEO SCREEN -- LITTLE GEEK'S CAMERA.  Passing  through a hatch, into a large grotto filled with pipes an machinery.  The engine room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting a reading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's twitching but it's below the  line you said was safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monk moves into the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Let's get in there. Wilhite and Schoenick follow him through the escape trunk into the dark corridor beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the darkness ahead emerges the trailing edge of th sail, big as a five-story building.  Far below her, Flatb moves along the edge of the ledge which supports the vast sub.  Its lights, and Lindsey's strobes, reveal the treme damage to the forward section as they pass the sail.  The torn and twisted hull looms above Flatbed as it sets down Coffey indicated an enormous rent where the bow section i almost torn away from the rest of the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go in through that large breach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, guys. Bud's team leaves Flatbed, swimming forward.  The opening a black mouth in their lights.  Coffey moves inside.  Bud attaches one end of an orange nylon line to a piece of pi and moves into the wreck behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it slow, stay on the line, and  stay in sight.  Watch for hatches  that could close on you, or any loose  equipment that could fall.
Jammer, Catfish, Finler, and Sonny follow him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They find themselves in the forward berthing compartment  with its rows of bunks.  The room is twisted and dishevel with bedding hanging from the bunks like the lolling tong of dead dogs.  Papers float in gentle eddying currents,  letters, pages from paperback novels, photos of girlfrien Bud pays out the line and follows Coffey forward.  As the pass sealed doors, Coffey pounds with a tool, listening. All flooded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monk leads his team along a corridor, following Little Ge tether.  Through a hatch into the engine room.  Their lig play over flooded machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the berthing Coffey's team swims up a companionway  towards the attack center.  He pulls at a buckled waterti door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's jammed.  Give me a hand. Jammer and Bud squeeze in around Coffey.  Together they w the door open on its squealing hinges.  It give way sudde flying open.  The suction pulls SOMETHING THROUGH.  It sl Bud's shoulder.  He turns.  A FACE... RIGHT IN FRONT OF HIM!  He jerks back, gasping. Face to face with Barnes, the sonarman.  The ensign seems unmarked, merely dismayed at his own mortality, judging f his wide eyes and mouth.  Coffey reaches past Bud and pus the ensign's body out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's keep moving.  We knew  we were going to see this. They enter the control room.  Their lights play over the  high-tech wreckage. Floating debris and bodies make shifting shadows on the w as they swirl in the currents.  A languid, weightless wal They move through the carnage. Their lights pick out tableaux... the planesman still str in his chair, someone jammed into the ceiling pipes, hang

down.  Dead faces, pale in the lights.  Still.  We see on glimpses. Coffey locates the captain's body and rolls it over.  Rem the missile arming key which hangs on a chain around the  dead man's neck.  Moves on. All business.  Bud turns back his guys.  Checking them.  He notices Jammer is breathing rapidly he's fogging his helmet.  Catfish, Finler, and So aren't much better.  A wave a panic seems imminent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you guys doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alright, I'm dealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Triple time sounds like a lotta money,  Bud.  It ain't.  I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here now.  Let's get her done. We see Bud working, calming them, talking them through it He's sweating rivers in his helmet, not looking too stead His projection of calm to the others is his own salvation Coffey pauses in the doorway to the communications room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This part I do alone.  Brigman, take  you men and continue aft.  Split up  into two teams of two.  Let's get  moving... we head back in fourteen  minutes. Bud leads his team into a narrow corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They search the rooms along the corridor with their light until they come to a vertical hatch, open.  a pit of dark below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Cat, Lew, Sonny.  You guys  stay on this deck.  Hook you line  onto mine.  Any problem, you tug my  line.  Two pulls.  Jammer, you're  with me. Bud drops down through the hatch to the level below, foll by Jammer, who
barely fits through.  Catfish hooks his safety line onto  Bud's with a carabiner and move along the corridor with t others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey circles the hull, documenting, photographing.  He strobes sear the darkness, give glimpses of the dead  leviathan's form as her tiny submersible circles it like bee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working from a plastic card, Coffey spins the dial on the wall safe and opens it.  He removes several plastic binde the code books.  He also grabs handfuls of classified  documents and orders, and a set of missile arming keys, a which he places in a pouch at his waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud leads Jammer through a long, claustrophobically narro corridor, tapping on the walls and hatches periodically. After he taps, he waits a few moments.  There are no answ taps.  They open doors and shine their lights into the ro The are bodies, but they seem anonymous.  Crumpled shapes khaki or blue.  They undog and open a hatch.  Beyond it i the largest chamber of the sub, the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missile compartment is the large gallery a hundred an twenty feet long and forty feet high, with two rows of  vertical launch tubes, 24 in all.  The chamber is divided into three levels by a floor of open steel grillwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missile compartment.  Those are the  launch tubes. They sweep their lights around the chamber.  Jammer turns his beam illuminating a body just beyond the door.  A  coveralled seaman turning slowly in the eddying current. Small albino crabs crawl slowly over the man's face.  One scuttles out of his gaping mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Almighty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you okay?
Bud goes to him.  Gets up close to his face.  Sees that h not.  That he's hyperventilating.  Fighting nausea.  Bud  grabs him by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep and slow, big guy.  Deep and  slow.  Just breathe easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... they're all dead, Bud.  They're  all dead.  I thought... some of  them... you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I'm okay now.  I just don't...  I can't go any further in. Bud sees that the big diver's breathing has stabilized. looks at his watch.  Checker Jammer's pressure gauges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jammer.  No problem.  You stay  right here.  I have to go there to  the end... you'll see my lights.   We'll stay in voice contact.  Just  hold onto the rope.  Five more  minutes.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.  Okay. He moves off through the center aisle of the gallery swim between the huge cylinders.  He pays out the lifeline as goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey is working rapidly and efficiently, moving from on rack of electronics gear to the next, setting thermite  grenades at vital points.  As the thermite ignites, it  generates an intense arc-bright light and tremendous heat The circuit chasses melt.  Coffey works calmly in the inf glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bed negotiates his way through the tangle of wreckage nea the far end of the missile compartment.  He goes down a  stairwell to the lower level.  A HUNDRED FEET AWAY, Jamme loses sight of Bud's dive-lights.  He starts to get nervo
Suddenly his own lights begin to DIM, flickering lower an lower. They become little orange candles, the filament barely  glowing.  The darkness closes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud?  BUD?!  You readin' me?  BUD?!! BUD, at the same moment, is fiddling with the connector c on his helmet lights, which are dimming and flickering. hears nothing from his helmet transceiver. JAMMER, smacks the side of his helmet.  Shakes the transc on his belt. Nothing... just static.  Then even the static dies.  Pani time. He grabs the safety line and pulls twice.  Hard.  It is  snagged on a sharp metal edge ten feet from him.  He pull twice more, harder, hauling the thing.  The line severs. Jammer stared at the frayed and floating toward him.  His eyes bug.  He looks all around in the darkness.  Can't se Bud.  Can't decide what to do.  We can see hysteria revvi up inside him like a flywheel. Then he becomes aware of a faint radiance flickering over the walls.  It is a cold and ethereal light, unlike the w white of their dive lights.  It grows brighter.  He turns slowly toward it. The glow is moving beneath the steel grill of the deck,  sending shafts of cold light flickering upward hypnotical coming toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud?  Is that you? C.U. JAMMER, shielding his eyes, staring into the radiant source. Guess what, Jammer?  It's not Bud.  In the brightest cent of the glow, SOMETHING is moving, a figure casting strang inhuman shadow across the walls. Jammer blinks against the glare, his face registering tot outright astonishment melting into terror. The glare pulses subtly, hypnotically.  The shifting shad falls across Jammer.  He finally snaps out of his fixity. Screaming and gulping air he spins away and starts clawin hand over hand through the treacherous wreckage.

His harness catches on a twisted pipe. He struggles, totally out of control... the big man reduc to a blind panic. Jammer heaves forward with all his adrenalized strength. He tears free of the entangling debris.  Launches like a  torpedo... slamming his backpack full force into the top  sill of the hatchway.  His tri-mix regulator takes the fu brunt of the impact. ON BUD, swimming furiously back toward Jammer's position. The strange radiance is gone.  His dive light flare back full brightness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jammer?  Answer me, buddy,  JAMMER?! He reaches Jammer only to find him thrashing violently in place.  A seizure. Bud grapples with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, big guy.  Hang on! Catfish, Sonny, and Finler arrive from the corridor a mom later.  They leap into the fray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's convulsing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his mixture!  Too much oxygen! Then they're all yelling at once, grappling with the big  man, struggling with the valves on his breathing gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crank it down, man!  We're gonna  lose him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIT, it's stuck... goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it?!  You got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah... yeah.  It's turning. Jammer's convulsion ends.  He goes limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get him out of here.  Come  on! (to Jammer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, buddy. They drag Jammer's slack form into the corridor, hauling  their way rapidly back along the lifeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey is approaching the monolith of the sail, maneuver to clear the horizontal diving plane.  Then her lights go dim and her thrusters lose power. Suddenly a bright corona breaks around the bulk of the sa and SOMETHING appears right in front of her, a glowing ob moving like a bat out of hell right at her!  It is slight smaller than submersible and we only get a glimpse.  What think we see in the diffuse glow is a translucent ovoid,  open at the front with a spinning vortex of light inside. like some hallucinatory jet engine.  And it's hauling ass Lindsey jinks left.  The object jogs right.  She fights t control as her sub slews around, slamming broadside into sail.  K-BAM!  Her power comes back up.  Righting Cab One she spins to look through the aft viewport in time to see the object racing away in a broad arc.  It pulls a high-G turn and dives straight down. We see the object zip behind Flatbed.  One Night can't se it.  The thing spirals down into the darkness like a hit- run drunk, diving along the wall into the abyss until it lost to view. HOLD ON Lindsey excited, amazed... dazed.  Her hands are  shaking.  Suddenly Bud's voice blares out over the open  frequency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAB ONE!  CAB ONE!  Meet me at  Flatbed!  This is a diver emergency!!   Do you copy?  Lindsey?! She has a hard time focusing on what he's saying.  Finall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy you, Bud.  On my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jammer is unconscious on a folding cot set up in the tiny cubicle of the infirmary.  Monk, who is cross-trained as medic as well as a demolitions man, has hung an IV of  something.  Bud and the SEAL are in the room, the others  hovering outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whattya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a medic, which is mostly about  patching holes.  This type of thing...  there's not much I can do.  The coma  could last hours or days. Bud, torn by guilt, gazes at the big man lying pathetical on the cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALs, minus Monk, are all gathered inside, debriefin with DeMarco via closed-circuit video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did any of you see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative.  But there was definitely  a Russian bogey.  The Brigman woman  saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CINCLANTFLT's gonna go apeshit.  Two  Russian attack subs, a Tango and  Victor, have been tracked within  fifty miles of here... and now we  don't know what the hell they are.   Okay, I don't have any choice.  I'm  confirming you to go to Phase Two. Wilhite and Schoenick glance uneasily at each other. Coffey is silent.  He is vibrating with tension... his fi clenched to prevent the shaking.  He is wrestling with th moment, knowing it is, in a way, a point of no return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I mean no.  Negative, sir. Coffey takes a deep breath.  Lets it out.  Phase Two is  clearly a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maintenance room doubles as a camera workstation.  An adjoining head serves as darkroom.  Lindsey is glumly  reassembling Cab One's camera housings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get anything on the cameras.   Video or anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Look, forget it.  I don't want  to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Be that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I saw.  Okay?   Coffey wants to call it a Russian  submersible, fine.  It's a Russian  submersible.  No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you think it's something else.   What?  One of ours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose then?  Lindsey?  Talk to me... Lindsey is wrestling with a feeling which is somehow also certain knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jammer saw something in there,  something that scared the hell out  him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mixture got screwed up.  He  panicked and pranged his regulator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what did he see that made him  panic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think he saw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I DON'T KNOW! Hippy comes pounding up, sticks his head in, gesturing  animatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys... hurry up, check  this out!  They're announcing it. They follow him into the corridor, trotting down to the m hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General melee as they rush in, everybody focused on the T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!  Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it up, bozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the Kremlin continues to deny  Russian involvement in the sinking  of the Trident sub USS Montana.  The  Navy has not released the names of  the 156 crewmembers, who are all  presumed dead at this time.  Civilian  employees of a Benthic Petroleum  offshore drilling rig--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey that's us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --are apparently participating in  the recovery operation but we have  little information about their  involvement.  On the scene now is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOOOH!  We want names!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey!  There's the Explorer. A LONG LENSE VIDEO SHOT of the Benthic Explorer and the o vessels in a stormy sea CUTS TO a shot of BILL TYLER, the scene reporter, in rain gear, clutching his microphone. is on the deck of a Navy support ship, being used as a st area from the press, well away from the center of the  operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --there is a tremendous amount of  activity.  With Cuba only 80 miles  away, the massive buildup of US ships  and aircraft in the area has drawn  official protest from Havana and  Moscow and has led to a redirection  of Soviet warships into the Caribbean  theater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you describe the mood there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mood is one of suspicion, even  confrontation.  A number of Russian  and Cuban trawlers, undoubtedly  surveillance vessels, have been  circling within a few miles throughout  the day, and Soviet aircraft have  repeatedly been warned away from the  area...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, Lindsey, and Hippy walking along the corridor, Hippy a black mood of incipient paranoia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're right in the middle of  this big-time international incident.   Like the Cuban Missile Crisis or  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured that out for yourself, did  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got Russian subs creeping around.   Shit! Something goes wrong they could say anything happened dow here, man.  Give our folks medals, know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy, just relax.  You're making  the women nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute, Virgil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean it.  Those SEALs aren't  telling us diddly.  Something's going  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy, you think everything's a  conspiracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is. One Night is pounding down the corridor from the sub bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up!  Coffey's splitting with  Flatbed! He got me to show him the  controls, then his guys suited up  and they're rolling. Bud breaks into a run, passing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit!  D'you tell him we need  it right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him we had to get the umbilical  unhooked ASAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud clears the door in time to see an empty moonpool, roi with turbulence. He runs to the edge and looks down.  Flatbed is a vague s moving off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is charcoal, the sea is a mountain range of gray  slopes.  Waves thunder over the foredeck, whipped by eigh knot winds.  Men in life jackets scurry like insects.  Of the port bow, the ASW destroyer ALBANY vanishes and reapp among waves sixty feet tall.  McBride scream orders that  can't be heard to the crewmen on deck.  He staggers back  along the bridge railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McBride steps into the quiet of the control room.  He tur on De Marco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're trying to get unhooked and get  out of here... and your boys go  sightseeing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be back in two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hours?!  We're gonna be getting  the shit kicked out of us by our  friend Fred in two hours! De Marco's expression is infuriatingly calm... icy.  McBr looks at his watch and swears under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a second time the black hull of the ballistic missile sub is illuminated by diver's lights.  Tiny figures, the  divers move like moths around a distant streetlight.  Wil Monk and Schoenick are clustered around an open missile h Using a large lift bag, they are removing the frangible  fiberglass, or 'diaphragm'.  Coffey pilots Flatbed with  increasing deftness, deploying the big arm to aid in the  work. DOWN ANGLE as the diaphragm lifts away... revealing the b nose of the TRIDENT C-4 MISSLE.  Like looking down the ba of a gun at the bullet aimed right at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON VIDEO SCREEN:  A HELICOPTER SHOT of a warship  burning, rolling ponderously as it sinks in stormy seas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little is known at this hour about  the events leading up to the  collision.  The US Navy guided missile   cruiser Appleton apparently struck  the Soviet 'Udaloy' class destroyer  in low visibility conditions... VARIOUS CUTS of men in life jackets among huge waves... R helicopters hovering.  Shaky camera work.  Wind blasting. INTERCUT WITH REACTIONS of the rig crew watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In violent seas little hope remains  for over a hundred Russian crewmen  still missing after the sinking an  hour ago. SHOT OF AMERICAN CRUISER, burning, listing to one side in heavy seas. Replaced by SHOT OF NETWORK ANCHORMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soviet military spokesmen have claimed  that the collision constituted an  unprovoked attack.  This was denied-- It continues.  Bud looks at Lindsey.  She turns to him,  expression grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, this is big time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The divers are working head-first in the missile's launch tube.  Monk reads from a plasticized card, directing the  other two step by step.  The arcane litany is punctuated the hissing rasp of their breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Separation sequencer disconnected.   Next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remove explosive bolts one through  six in counterclock-wise sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check... removing bolt one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE RIG CREW, watching.  Bathed in the light of the vi screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just learned that Soviet  negotiators have walked out of the  strategic arms limitation summit in  protest over the incident this  morning. Bud switches the channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... US and NATO military forces have  been put on full alert worldwide  this morning in the wake of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on every channel. Bud switches again.  Reception is getting worse as the st affect the satellite down-link to Explorer.  THE SCREEN s a reporter on a city street, stopping people at random.   Their answers are edited together:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just feel so hopeless.  You can  see it coming, but what can you do?   What can anyone do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, they don't want war any more  than we do.  You think about it, you  say... hey, they love their kids  too.  So why are we doing this? He is replaced by a self-righteous, middle-aged woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the Russians sank that submarine,  they deserve what they got and a lot  more, if you ask me, and you did.  I  think we've been pussyfooting around  with them long enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now clear what the SEALs are doing.
