Using large li bags and Flatbed's big arm, they have pulled one of the  Trident C-4 missiles partway out of its launch tube, and  have partially disassembled the nose-shroud, exposing sev of the MIRV warheads within. Moving very carefully, Wilhite and Schoenick ease one of individual MIRVs out of its bracket.  Hanging under a lif bag in a jerry-rigged harness, the three-foot long warhea is move gently by the divers to the back of Flatbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another man in the street interview, tortured by static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared?  I'm scared ____-less.  But  if it happens it happens, nothing I  can do about it.  Right?  So why  think about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flatbed surfaces in boiling foam.  The rig crew are all  waiting.  Like a crack pit-crew Bud's people leap onto Fl while its deck is still awash and start to work on the Na divers, unsealing their helmets and uncoupling their  umbilicals.  Hippy and Bud start to untie a cylindrical o wrapped in one of the SEAL's gear bags.  Coffey emerges f the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that.  Just step away.   Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excusez moi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey, we're a little pressed for  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monk, Schoenick... secure the package. The two SEALs unlash the object in the black bag.  Bud an Lindsey exchange a glance.  He glares at Coffey as they p each other.  One Night nimbly climbs the hatch-tower and  drops in.  Bud swings the heavy hatch up, balancing it, a grins down at One Night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't no drill, slick.  Make me  proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of cake, baby. He swings the hatch closed with a CLANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big A-frame, massive as a railroad bridge, to which t umbilical from the Explorer is attached.  Flatbed rises I FRAME arcing around the coupling mechanism F.G.  One Nigh deploys the big hydraulic arm. It unfold from Flay bed like a huge steel spider leg, its claw-like 'gripper' opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALARM sounds stridently on the dynamic-positioning con

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing number two thruster.   Bearing's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep in one of the catamaran hulls, the positioning thrus motor is SCREAMING like a steel banshee above its usual r It EXPLODES with smoke and shrapnel.  A roaring fire erup Crewmen run shouting in the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now a KLAXON is going off as the ship begins to slew in t high winds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not holding.  We're swinging  out of position!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ship slews, the umbilical is drawn off vertical. goes tight as a bowstring.  Pulled to the edge of the lau well, it rips down the side with a godawful screech, tear loose ladders and floats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flatbed's manipulator has gripped the de-coupling mechani when the cable suddenly pulls taut.  The sub is jerked  sideways, its grip dislodged.  We see One Night get tosse around inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey is in the corridor with a cup of tea when the who rig BOOMS LIKE A GONG and lurches sideways.  She's wearin her tea when Bud tears through a doorway and goes poundin past her.  The intercom blares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud to control!  Emergency!  Bud to  Control! Bud claws his way up the ladder to level two.  The rig BO and shudders as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rig begins to move. The enormous skid breaks loose.   Starts to slide, plowing furrows in the bottom.  One Nigh junks the controls, pivoting her submersible as the A-fra looms toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud runs in, past Hippy, and grabs the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topside, topside... pay out some  slack, we're getting dragged!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The winch man staggers along the railing, blasted by 80-k winds.  He sprints for the base of the enormous crane whi supports the umbilical winch.  A wave blasts him into the bulkhead.  He half-crawls to the ladder going up to the w house.  As he climbs the winch's heave-compensator slides and down, FILLING FRAME behind him. It is bottoming-out with a sound like a piledriver, overl by the strain on the cable.  It chooses that moment to fa GRINDING CRASH OF METAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey has joined Bud, looking out the front viewport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're heading right for the drop  off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deck is ripped upward as the entire 40-ton crane is p over by the weight of Deepcore.  It topples in the launch well with a roar of tortured steel that rivals the storm. An EXPLOSION OF WATER.  UNDERWATER, the crane tumbles bet the twin hulls.  Trailing a vortex of foam and debris, it roars down on us, FILLING FRAME WITH BLACKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McBride stares in shock at the churning cauldron of the l well.  Grabs the underwater telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud!  We've lost the crane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Say again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is stunned by what is happening.  Lindsey fires the sonar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it!  It's dropping straight to  us. She puts the signal over the speakers and the room fills  with eerie PINGING. Bud shouts over the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rig for impact!  Seal all exterior  hatches.  Move it!  Let's go! VARIOUS ANGLES, QUICK CUTS, as everyone runs to comply: The rig crew pounding down the narrow corridors.  Diving  through low hatchways.  Hatches are closed and the wheels spun down.  Hippy puts Beany into a ZIP-LOK BAG and seals it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The umbilical drops down in slack loops out of the blackn above, draping itself over the habitat in large coils.  O Night pilots her submersible feverishly among the falling loops.  She banks and twists.  A length of heavy umbilica slams onto her neck, tipping the sub. She manages to get out from under it a keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the front viewport they can see the coils of cabl piling up in front of the rig.  The hull booms with impac as the massive stuff hits. Everyone hold their breath as the sonar return-pings get  closer... and closer.  And closer... An ENORMOUS SHAPE plunges into the floodlight in front of the rig. K-WHAM!!  The 40-ton crane hits like a flatiron thirty fe in front of them. A clean miss.  Much WHOOPING AND CHEERING.  Then... The crane topples slowly over the back.  It rolls down th slope of the drop-off, gathering speed.  Then tumbles ove the cliff into the abyssal canyon. The coiled umbilical starts to pay out after it like rope after a harpoon. And they're still attached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. An agonizing few seconds.  Then... the cable pulls taut. K-BOOM!!  The rig is slammed by the shock.  Everyone is  knocked off his feet, into walls and equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rig begins to slide.  It tilts over the embankment an grinds down the slope of the drop-off in a cloud of silt. The cable pulling it inexorably toward the cliff.  The  framework twists and slams into rocks.  SCREECHING AND  GROANING of tortured steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hell has broken loose.  SIRENS, SCREAMING, a KLAXON  HOOTING moronically. Bud sprints from Control, bouncing off the corridor walls the rig lurches and tilts.  The lights go out.  Emergency light come on.  He trips and falls, scrambles up, running on. IN THE LADDERWELL of trimodule C, Lindsey runs toward the machine rooms. K-BOOM!  A searing bright EXPLOSION in the electrical roo Flames roar through the doorway.  She dashes to a seawate hose hanging nearby and starts to unroll it.  She sees Co and Schoenick in maintenance, lashing down the mystery  package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Get on this hose, you turkeys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monk is working in a spray of seawater, turning valves to stop the flow of ruptured pipes.  Behind him, a wall of f blossoms through the door from the electrical room, drivi the back with the heat.  A reservoir-tanks breaks loose f one of the compressor assemblies.  In rolls at him, crush his legs against machinery.  The fire roars into the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy runs in.  The place is going nuts.  Water floods fr the moonpool as the rig tilts.  Wilhite is dancing across the deck, leaping over compressed-gas cylinders which are rolling around loose.  Cab One jumps clear off its cradle and slides SCREECHING across the deck.  Wilhite, running  before the 12-tom juggernaut, had no place to go.  The SE dives into the churning moonpool.  Cab One slams into the end wall, then spins and rolls toward Hippy. He starts to run.  Drop something.  Looks back. Beany, in his zip-loc bag, is lying in the path of the sl submersible. Hippy runs back.  Scoops up the baggie.  Cab One FILLS FR behind him. He makes it through the door an instant before the thing  hits behind him, buckling the steel doorframe.

Wilhite is clawing up the sheep skirting of the moonpool. He gets his fingers over the top.  Pulls himself up... A steel helium tank slams against his fingers, crushing t and he falls back.  More tanks bounce over the lip of the pool, hammering Wilhite down into the foaming water. He doesn't surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rig is sliding to the edge of the cliff.  Beyond it.. the bottomless pit of the Cayman Trough.  It slams, crush and twisting, into a rock outcropping and stops, hanging  over the precipice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry is trapped as the trimodule floods with stunning  swiftness.  He makes it through an emergency hatch betwee floors but can't get it closed.  The inrushing tide blast it open.  He scramble upward to the next hatch.  Spins th wheel.  No time.  He is slammed against the ceiling by th force of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lew Finler, Tommy Ray Dietz, and Lupton McWhirter fight t way toward the door as the drill room floods rapidly.  Ah the big automated watertight door is closing like a motor bank-vault.  They reach it just as it is closing, but can prevail against the strength of the motors.  FROM THE FAR SIDE, we can see them screaming soundlessly at the tiny  pressure window in the door.  We can hear the dull THUNK their pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey and Schoenick, in emergency breathing masks, are  fighting the fire with a seawater hose and fire extinguis Smoke and steam choke the dark chambers. Nearby, Lindsey grabs Hippy's arm as he is running past a drags him into the blazing compressor room.  Hands him he seawater hose.  Wide-eyes, he starts blasting everything sight with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Hold it on me! She rushed into the teeth of the fire as Hippy blasts her with a spray of water, following her into the intense hea
She grabs Monk, who is semiconscious, and drags him out o the blazing room... Hippy dancing back with the hose,  tripping, blasting her in the face. But it works.  They get Monk clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud comes pounding down the flooding corridor in time to the water in the rill room swirl above the pressure windo obscuring the faces of the trapped men.  He claws futilit at the door.  The motors and the fail-safe latching mecha are on the opposite side.  Through the pressure window he watches helplessly as they drown.  We don't see what he s but we know what he sees.  Suddenly the bulkhead next to gives way and a freezing torrent thunders in.  Bud is blo off his feet a hurled along the corridor. He scramble up somehow, splashing waist deep toward the  opposite end of the corridor where another of the hydraul doors is closing inexorably.  He's not going to make it. reaches it a moment too late to squeeze through. Grabs the edge of the door and desperately tries to stop from closing with the strength of this arms.  It doesn't  work.  The steel door closes on the fingers of his left h pinning them in the doorframe. But something amazing happens.  His wedding ring lodges  between the door and frame, preventing his fingers from b crushed and the door from sealing and locking. It resists tons of pressure, denting but not collapsing. The freezing sea pours in until only his head is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heeyy!!  HHHEEEYYY!! ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR, Catfish and Sonny come pou up.  They see his face at the tiny window and his hand ja in the door.  Sonny wedges a crowbar in the narrow openin and starts to pry.  Catfish whips open his jackknife and  slashes the hydraulic hoses on the door actuator.  He is  sprayed with red hydraulic fluid, machine blood. Together they force open the door.  Bud is blown through a torrent of water.  Sonny is thrown back into some pipes Breaks his arm. Together they somehow heave the door shut manually, cutti off the flow. Catfish hammers the fail-safe latch home with the crowbar
Bud lies gasping and shivering... staring at the tiny ban of metal that saved him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DEEPCORE/ONE HOUR LATER
dialogues.text: LOOKING DOWN THE WALL of the canyon as Big Geek moves ben us, tilting up to show Deepcore perched at the very edge the abyss.  The rig is twisted and dented, covered with l of umbilical, trimodule-A a mass of wreckage. The ROV passes across the front of the control module.   Through the front port, two figures can be seen in the li of a single emergency lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayday, mayday.  This is Deepcore  Two calling Benthic Explorer.  Do  you read, over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny flips some switches on the UQC acoustic transceiver Tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benthic Explorer, Benthic Explorer.   Do you read, over?  This is Deepcore--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, Sonny.  They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud walks down the corridor from control, slowly... as if carrying a great weight.  The air is still thick with smo The power off... everything lit by emergency lights.   Makeshift quarters have been set up in the mess hall, wit blankets laid out on the tables, and with folding cots in the storage room across the hall.  Jammer is still  unconscious.  Coffey and Schoenick bring Monk in on a  stretcher, and set him up on a table.  He is conscious bu dazed with painkillers, his led splinted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find Wilhite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He and Bud lock eyes.  Bud bites back on his recriminatio but his gaze blames Coffey.  He turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brigman. (Bud turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was under orders.  I had no choice. Coffey's manner is subdued, contrite.  A marked contrast his previous brusque arrogance.  He's wrestling with his loss, a sever blow to the tight brotherhood of a SEAL uni Bud's anger is not dispelled.  But he can't address it no He moves on. PAST THE INFIRMARY, where Sonny Dawson is rigging a sling over his own broken arm.  He cries out in pain, cursing a himself.  LOOKING DOWN THE CENTRAL WELL as Bud crosses.   Down through the grill decking we can see the bottom leve of the module is flooded.  Catfish is down there welding, sending shivering reflections through the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey is working, up to her knees in water.  She is cov with grease, tools scattered around.  Bud puts his hand o her shoulder.  She looks up, blows some hair out of her e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the scoop, ace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get power to this module and  sub-bay if I remote these busses.   I've gotta get past the mains, which  are a total melt-down. Rather than trigger anger and invective, the disaster see to have affected her in a different way.  She's accepted situation, now that's it's done, and is immersing herself technical tasks, which are for her therapeutic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need some help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  No, I can handle it.  Bud...  there won't be enough to run the  heaters.  In a couple hours this  place is going to be as cold as a  meat locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about O-2?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brace yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got about 12 hours worth if we  close off the sections we're not  using.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm's gonna last longer than  12 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can extend that.  There's some  storage tanks outboard on the wrecked  module.  I'll have to go outside to  tie onto them. She goes back to her task, working efficiently with a soc wrench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Lins... (she looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad your here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  Well I'm not. The sub bay is still a mess.  Dark.  A few battery-operat lamps.  Flatbed is back, floating in the moonpool. One Night and Hippy are in deep concentration, piloting t two ROVs in an image survey of the rig.  Bud comes up beh them, check her screen first. BIG GEEK'S MONITOR shows a view of the aft section of the rig.  The drilling derrick had collapsed across Cab Three totaling it.  A girder is jammed through its acrylic fron dome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right through the brainpan.  Deader'n  dogshit, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hippy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quarters.  Level two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Geek rises up through the open central hatch, pivo in a circle to scan the flooded interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON VIDEO SCREEN, LITTLE GEEK'S POV.  The interior o the structure is a shambles.  The lights of the little ro fall upon a figure... Perry.  Lying on the deck, almost  looking like he's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Perry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lets his breath out  slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it then.  Finler, McWhirter,  Dietz, and Perry.  Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestured at the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we just leave him there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, for now.  Our first priority's  to get something to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish and Lindsey, in suits and helmets, drop down from the glare of the moonpool onto the dark sea floor under t rig.  Walking, they pull their umbilicals behind them and head out through the twisted wreckage.  Little Geek follo along like a dog at their heels.  They settle beside a va assembly at the base of the wrecked module.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat, you tie onto this manifold.   There's some tanks on the other side;  I'm gonna go check them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch yourself. He begins to attach one end of a coiled-up high-pressure  hose to a manifold. She takes the other end of the hose and moves off into th darkness.  Little Geek goes with her faithfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cab One is hanging from the overhead crane while One Nigh works to repair it.
Bud is nearby, tending hose for the divers and handing he tools.  Talking while they work.  Hippy is across the moo running Little Geek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a three-eighths socket on a  long extension. (he hands it to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there you were--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we were, side by side, on the  same ship, for two months.  I'm tool- pusher and we're testing this  automated derrick of hers.  So, we  get back on the beach and... we're  living together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean you had to marry her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were due to go back out on the  same ship.  Six months of tests.  If  you were married you got a state- room.  Otherwise it was bunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, good reason.  Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was alright for a while, you know.   But then she got promoted to project  engineer on this thing, couple years  ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went front-office on you.  Tighten  that for me, right there.  That's  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know Lindsey, too damn  aggressive-- Son of a--!! He's jammed his fingers with a wrench torquing down a bol Whips his hand out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't leave me... she just left  me behind. She puts her arm around his shoulders, somehow managing t be fraternal, maternal and suggestive all at the same tim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, let me tell you something.  She  ain't half as smart as she thinks  she is. She smiles and pretends to kink Lindsey's air-hose. ACROSS THE CHAMBER, Hippy scowls as Little Geek's screen  starts to go haywire with interference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Lindsey, you reading me?  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish is working on one side of the wrecked module whil Lindsey is on the other, out of sight.  She is standing o the bottom at the base of the wreckage, checking valves o rack of oxygen bottles amongst the wreckage. Right at the edge of the canyon wall.  Behind her is a sh drop to nothingness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Hippy, I read you.  What's the  matter? The reply is GARBLED by a wash of static.  Then, for no  apparent reason, Lindsey's helmet light begins to dim out Little Geek's lights fade.  His motors whine to a stop. ON CATFISH, as his lights drop to candleglows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emergency lights are dimming, like a brownout.  Bud g the diver intercom mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lins, how're you doing?  Lindsey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LINDSEY, as she fiddles with her lights and transceive pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish... I got a problem here.   You there?  Catfish? Behind her, SOMETHING rises from the depths. It is the little vehicle she almost collided with at the  Montana wreck.

It comes right up behind her.  She doesn't know it's ther It hovers sideways like a hummingbird, as if curious, try to get a better look.  She becomes aware of the pulsing g on the ground around her.  She turns slowly.  We see her  react as the glowing, pulsing apparition is reflected in faceplate. A more powerful glow washes up onto her from below.  Her  eyes go down.  She gasps, absolutely stunned... Above the edge of the wall, AN ENORMOUS SHAPE RISES SILEN OUT OF THE DEPTHS.  Over sixty feet across.  It looks lik blown glass manta ray, its transparent outer hull housing interior structures of great delicacy and complexity, pul with a blue-violet glow. Lindsey stand before it, unable to move.  Absolutely rapt Captivated by its ethereal beauty.  It begins to turn,  majestically, one rounded wing passing only a few feet ab her.  She reaches up.  Touches it as it passes over her. Lindsey is without fear, completely mesmerized. The thing completes its turn and dives gracefully down al the wall.  She is gently lifted by a backwash of turbulen water. About that time, Lindsey remembers she has a still camera little Nikonos. She fumbles to set focus and exposure with her bulky glov as the beautiful machine glides into the depths.  Gets al set for a shot and... WOOSH!  The little 'scoutschip' whizzes past her from beh startling her. She completely misses the shot of the 'manta ship'.  She  pivots, trying to get a shot of the little one as it zig- zags down along the wall, fast as a meteor.  CLICK.  She a shot a second before it disappears. From around the flank of the rig module, Catfish appears. Their com-sets come backs to life, along with their light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not say you missed that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missed what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON SLIDE STRIP.  Lindsey's fingertip in for scale. The shot is black with a little squiggle of light in the  center.  Pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shot, Lins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?  You drop your dive  light? WIDER, SHOWING THE GROUP huddled around Lindsey who has h freshly-processed slide roll laid out on the pinball mach using it as a light table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you guys... look, this is  the little one right here.  You can  see how it's kind of zigging around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so.  It could be anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you what is there.  You're  just not hearing.  The impulses  somehow aren't getting from you ears  to your brainpan.  There's something  down there.  Something not... us. She looks around.  Sees a lot of skepticism in the eyes a her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all could be more specific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not us.  Not human.  Get it?   Something non-human, but  intelligent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like Coffey? Lindsey is reddening.  Despite her conviction, this is re hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A non-terrestrial intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Non-Terrestrial Intelligence.  NTIs.   Yeah, I like that better then UFOs.   Although that works too... Underwater  Flying Objects. Hippy is not really mocking her.  He's actually into it. But it has that effect.  Catfish is eyeing Lindsey like h never seen her before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we talkin' little space friend  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on!  Hot rods of the Gods.   Right, Lins?  Hey, no really!  It  could be NTIs.  The CIA has known  about them for years.  They abduct  people all the time.  There was this  woman I knew in Albuquerque who--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy, do me a favor... stay off my  side. Bud takes her firmly by the arm.  Heads her out into the  corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey, will you step into my office  for a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He propels her along the corridor, away from the mess hal doorway.  They face each other in the narrow space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Lindsey--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, something really important is  happening here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  I'm just trying to hold this  situation together.  I can't allow  you to cause this kind of hysteria--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's hysterical?  Nobody's  hysterical!
They're talking across each other, not connecting.  Bud w and frustrated. Lindsey is cranked up with the afterglow of her encounter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is when you're hanging  on by your fingernails, you don't go  waving you arms around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw something!  I'm not going to  go back there and say I didn't see  it when I did.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you are the most stubborn woman  I ever knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to believe me, Bud.  Look  at me.  Do I seem stressed out?  Any  of the symptoms of pressure sickness,  any tremors, slurred speech?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, this is me, Lindsey.  Okay?   You know me better than anybody in  the world.  Now watch my lips... I  saw these things.  I touched one of  them.  And it wasn't some clunky  steel can like we would build... it  glided.  It was the most beautiful  thing I've ever seen. Bud is stilled by her intensity.  She moves close to him. Eyes alive and luminous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a machine, but it seems almost  alive.  Like a... dance of light.   Bud, you have to trust me... please.   I don't think they mean us harm.  I  don't know how I know that, it's  just a feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I go on a feeling?  You think  Coffey's going to go on you 'feeling'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all see what we want to see...  Coffey looks and he sees Russians,  he sees hate and fear.  Bud, you  have to look with better eyes than  that. Bud has been taking this all in.  His eyes tracking her f He closes his eyes, taking a deep breath.  It's so hard f him to do this, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, Lindsey.  I'm sorry.  How  can I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey has Bud, Lindsey and several of the rig crew gathe for a little summit.  Lindsey is withdrawn, sitting far f the others, a self-imposed exile.  They're all wearing wa clothes and hugging themselves.  Their breath shows in th air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want 'round-the-clock manning of  the sonar shack and the exterior  cameras.  We need early warning if  the Soviet craft try another  incursion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a break!  Coffey, these things  live three and a half miles down on  the bottom of an abyssal trench!   Trust me... they're not speaking  Russian. Coffey looks at her for a moment, then goes on as if she  hadn't spoken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to One Night)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't you finished repairs on  the hydrophone transmitter yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was having my nails done. Coffey is sweating, despite the chill.  Keeps his hands  clenched in fists so they won't see how bad the tremors h gotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get something straight.  You people  are under my authority--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, podner... we don't work for  you, we don't take orders from you,  and we don't much like you.  In  addition to which your momma dresses  you funny. Coffey's eyes are straight razors.  He slashes them from  face to face.  You can see him tightening up like a  clockspring, losing control of the situation in front of own men.  Bud defuses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Fish'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the first watch in sonar.  Hippy,  you handle the exterior surveillance.   One Night, see if you can get that  transmitter working for me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a couple of hours. HOLD ON COFFEY as everyone leaves.  Winding tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey and Schoenick are bending over the warhead.  They  have a small port removed and are attaching waterproof le from an ELECTRONIC DETONATOR.  The black box Lindsey glim earlier.  As the two SEALs work like surgeons, we see pas Coffey's shoulder to a hemispherical window behind him, w looks out into the perpetual blackness.  Something appear a goofy shark face. Big Geek rises silently in front of the port.  It moves a little, trying to get a peek over Coffey's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy is twiddling his joysticks, watching the screen lik ferret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... move to the left... just  a little more... come on, A.J. Squared  Away... that's it-- ON THE SCREEN, Geek's POV.  Coffey is blocking Hippy's vi of whatever it is they're working on.  Abruptly, be moves The warhead is lying there in plain sight, detonator wire hooked up.  Hippy's eyes bug out.  He knows exactly what is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty radical, guys.  Pretty radical. He hurries to the VCR and puts it into RECORD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Video image of the SEALs working.  It FREEZES on a clear  view of the warhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to MIRV. Bud has his face right up to screen.  He frowns, skeptica

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man.  What else could it  be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why bring it here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gotta be, like, an emergency  plan to keep it away from the  Russians... Hotwire one of the nukes  with some kinda detonator, put it  back in the sub, and fry the whole  thing, slicker'n snot.  Oh, uh...  hi, Lins. Bud whips around.  Lindsey, standing quietly in the doorw It's apparent from expression she's been watching them fo some time.  She looks ready to kill somebody.  Then she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud catches up to her in the corridor, trying to put the  brakes on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, goddamnit, if you won't do  something about it, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey!  Wait a second-- She reaches the watertight door to Maintenance Room B.  I locked.  Before Bud can stop her she grabs a fire-extingu off the wall and pounds on the steel door like a big gong

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: Needless to say, it opens.  She pushes past Schoenick, se the bomb lying there naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got some huevos bringing  this...  thing... into my rig!  With  everything that's been going on up  in the world, you bring a nuclear  weapon in here?  Does this strike  anyone as particularly psychotic, or  is it just me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to know the details  of this mission... you're better off  if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right... I don't.  I just  need to know that this thing is out  of here!  You hear me, Roger Ramjet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Brigman, you're becoming a  serious impediment to this mission.   I believe the stress is affecting  you. (to Schoenick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escort her to quarters and have Monk  prepare a tranquilizer. Schoenick takes her arm in a tight grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit, you can't do that.  Oww...  goddamnit! Lindsey goes bananas, trying to get Schoenick's big hands off her arms.  Bud slams his hand down on the intercom bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency!  Maintenance room B.   Emergency! He pulls the fire alarm for good measure and spins on  Coffey... warning him with a look that is not to be messe with.  Coffey is braced back against the worktable... an stance, with one arm behind his back.  Suddenly there's a crowd outside the door as Catfish, Hippy, One Night, and  Sonny come running up.  Confrontation time. Sirens going.  About a million volts of electricity in th air.  Bud braces Schoenick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go.  Do it... right now. He does.  Lindsey jerks away.  Rubs her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dumb jarhead motherf--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill out, Lindsey!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem? Everyone is frozen in place.  Bud a Coffey... snake and  mongoose, glaring. Bud pulls Lindsey back into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  We were just leaving. (to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't we? ANGLE FROM BEHIND COFFEY, as Bud's group moves out of sig up the corridor. Hands behind his back.  In his hand, cocked, finger on th trigger, is the .45.  He turns and sets it on the table,  steadying himself as if in the wind.  He seems to sag.  W he looks at Schoenick, his eyes are wounds.  A hunted ani Voice shaky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't be trusted.  They're  turning against us.  We may have to  take... steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey, Bud, Hippy.  Bud slows, letting them trail behin the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lins, stay away from that guy.  I  mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  The dude's in bad shape...  you see his hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got the shakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the guy's operating on his  own, cut off from chain of command.   He's exhibiting symptoms of pressure- induced psychosis.  And he's got a  nuclear weapon.  So, as a personal  favor to me...  will you put your  tongue in neutral for a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I give this a sphincter-factor  of about nine point five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey goes to the dome port.  Looks past his shrunken an twisted reflection into the void.  Eternal night. ANGLE FROM OUTSIDE.  Coffey's face in the window.  Stuck the acrylic bubble beside him is one of those Garfields,  suction cups on its paws.  Coffey stares out.  Behind his eyes, his brain is like that cat, just hanging on, spread and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a single worklight, a couple of conspirators.  Lind and Hippy hunch over Big Geek.  The ROV grins maniacally  with goofy shark teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you can just punch into his  little chip where you want him to  go, and he goes, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, but the tether off it  ain't gonna be fancy.  When he gets  down there he'll just sit, like a  dumb-shit.  Unless something wanders  through view of the camera, you'll  get nada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go for it.  We could get lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE SURVEILLANCE MONITOR.  Lindsey and Hippy next to Big  Geek.  Their voices are tinny but intelligible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I really oughta talk  to Bud about this. E.C.U. COFFEY.  Watching them in the dark.  Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Just you and me.  We get some  proof, then tell them.  Hippy, look...  if was can prove to Coffey it's not  Russians, maybe he'll ease off the  button a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta tell you, that guy scares me  a lot more than whatever's down there.   A.J. Squared Away goddamn jarhead  robot.  Okay, gimme a couple hours  on this. Coffey watches, his jaw clenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are down.  Those who can are grabbing some sle Snoring comes from one of the bunkrooms as Lindsey passes In the mess hall, Catfish and Bud are crashed out on the  tables, wrapped in blankets.  The cold has gotten intense Water drips.  The walls sweat with condensation.  Lindsey can see her breath as she makes coffee.  She carries a cu over to Monk, who is a face in a pile of blankets.  A han comes out, takes the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Lindsey sips hers, staring.  Her thoughts are far away... the bottomless pit.
She is leaning up against the table where Bud is sleeping His soft snoring downshifts into a loud rasp.  Lindsey to him gently on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgil, turn on your side. Bud grunts and turns without waking, an automatic respons The snoring stops.  It is a quiet, intimate moment, a rem of the mileage these two have logged together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny has made himself comfortable in front of the screen Too comfortable. He's asleep, chin on his chest.  On the main passive-sona screen, an almost imperceptibly faint trace appears.  A H which is by now familiar, becomes audible.  Sonny shifts his seat.  Doesn't wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy puts his tools away, finished with the modification to Big Geek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All set, big guy.  Hey, I told you  to wipe that grin off your face. He yawns as he shambles across the chamber to the corrido door.  Switches off the lights.  Goes out. Quiet lapping of water in the moonpool.  A beat.  Then... A cold luminosity suffuses the water beneath the moonpool opening, sending shadows shifting across the top of the  chamber.  The surface begins to pulsate. Suddenly, the water itself rises, forming itself into a  shifting, shimmering pseudopod as big around as a man's b The transparent form pulses... an amoebic mass shivering the air. It stretches, becoming a more refined form.  Like a blind probing glass python, it elongates and weaves across the  room.  It extends and extends, stretching out from the  moonpool, a shimmering tentacle.  The 'head' or tip, a  featureless liquid bulb, seems somehow to be scanning as moves forward, as if it can see where it's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy trudges along the dark corridor.  He reaches the me head and goes in. As the door closes, the tip of the liquid pseudopod exten into the corridor B.G.  It 'looks' left and right.  Then  extends the length of the corridor, holding itself a coup feet off the floor like a weightless snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING DOWN three levels through the central ladderwell  between the cylinders.  The pseudopod enters and undulate upward. FROM INSIDE THE MAKESHIFT BUNKROOM, we see its tip extend inside. Sonny and One Night are snoring, oblivious.  Jammer is st unconscious.  The pseudopod, taking its time, checks them out and then moves on. IN THE MESS HALL, it's dark and quiet.  Lindsey has even  fallen asleep in her chair, her head buried in her arms o the table.  The shimmering tentacle enters the room in to silence.  It sways gracefully in to air, searching. It undulates across the room, hanging about five feet in air, surveying everything.  It moves past Lindsey.  Sensi something, she lifts her head, turning... sees the appari next to her. Her eyes go wide.  Amazement, but not fear.  The tentacle moving on, still searching.  Lindsey shakes Bud awake,  clapping her hand over his mouth. Bud blinks twice, then freezes.  When she lowers her hand his mouth is hanging open like a total goon. Bud chucks his pillow are Catfish, on the next table. Catfish cracks one eye open.  Turns away.  Turns right ba both eyes open now.  Sensing movement, the thing turn bac toward them.  It seems to recognize Lindsey.  It doubles  back on itself in a loop and comes right up to her.  She  holds her ground, fascinated. The bulbous tip forms suddenly into a human face... her f It is water, still clear and undulating... but definitely Lindsey.  She gasps in surprise. The liquid-Lindsey gasps soundlessly... a perfect mimic o her expression.

Lindsey laughs involuntarily.  It laughs... without sound Lindsey makes a face, sticking out her tongue... testing The liquid-Lindsey does the same.  Bud has just had the r jerked out from under his sense of what is possible and w isn't, but he's taking it pretty will, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's trying to communicate. Her liquid face suddenly transforms into a likeness of Bu She reaches out her hand slowly.  Gingerly, her fingers t the surface. Ripples extend outward from the contact, across Bud's  features. Her fingertips break effortlessly through the surface, ju like she's dipping her hand into a bowl of water, except  sideways.  She draws her wet fingers out and studies them amazed.  Touches one fingertip to her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seawater. The pseudopod pulls back from her.  It loops in the air  dramatically, full circle... and ties itself into a knot. As the knot tightens down, it melts back into the body. 'disappearing knot' trick. Lindsey laughs, grinning with the open wonder and delight a child at a magic show.  She is transported.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show off. She looks at Bud.  He grins broadly.  He's with her now. The stunned group watches as the thing moves on across th room.  Out to the corridor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey and Schoenick enter the back way, through the dive prep area.  They see the pseudopod arching from the moonp big as a treetrunk.  Coffey's mind is blown.  We can smel the insulation burning.  He just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water tentacle enters and moves toward the hot-wired  warhead.  It studies the device for a few seconds.  Bud a Lindsey enter through a side door, in time to see the ten divide into four tendrils which wrap around the warhead. They begin to lift it off its cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey finally jump-starts his brain.  In a flash of insi he runs to the big sliding door through which the pseudop stretches into the corridor.  He and Schoenick heave on t door.  Like a guillotine blade it slices effortlessly thr it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAINTENANCE... as the body of the pseudopod collapses,  splashing on the floor.  It reverts to nothing more than long puddle of simple seawater.  As the tendrils dissolve the warhead slams back down onto the cart, unharmed.  ON  COFFEY'S SIDE ON THE DOOR, however, the "stump" rears bac like a cobra.  It withdraws rapidly into the moonpool.  T glow fades away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny wakes up with a start as the HUM revs up into a LOU WHINE and then fades away.  He scrambles to track it.  To late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy emerges from the can and looks down, puzzled, at th puddle running the length of the corridor.  He missed the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light on.  Everybody there.  Lindsey is really strutting, high on life, now that she's been proven right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, raise your hand if you think  that was a Russian water-tentacle.   Lieutenant?  No?  Well, a  breakthrough. Coffey is looking out from under his eyebrows like Nichol in "The Shining". Bud give her a warning look.  Don't poke at the rattler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done impressing yourself, ace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way that could just be seawater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must've learned how to control  water... I mean at a molecular level.   They can plasticize it, polymerize  it... whatever.  Put it under  intelligent control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe their whole technology is based  on that.  Controlling water. Coffey is hunched over, elbows on his knees.  His hands a out of sight.  His arm is moving in a slow rhythm.  We ca see what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing was probably their version  of Big Geek... like an ROV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just checking is out, huh?  How come? ANGLE UNDER THE TABLE, showing what Coffey is doing.  He his K-BAR KNIFE gripped white-knuckle in one hand.  He is drawing it slowly and repeatedly across the skin of the o forearm.  Neat chevrons of blood from wrist to elbow. C.U. COFFEY -- He doesn't flinch.  His eyes are hard and  bright as diamond rills.  No one notices.  He's keeping t edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're curious, maybe.  We could be  the first people they've seen up  close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope they don't judge the whole race  offa us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I oughta shave. Coffey stands abruptly, snags Schoenick with his eyes, an leaves, walking through the group as if they were smoke. This cold behavior brings the mood own a notch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the mess hall, Coffey pauses, listening to the  conversation resume. Bright speculation, a few jokes.  Coffey is visible shaki Breathing hard. Pupils dilated.  Schoenick looks at him with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It went straight for the warhead.   And they think it's cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get some sleep. Coffey walks away without hearing him.  Schoenick catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens in the dark room.  Coffey enters, moving w purpose.  He pulls his gear bag out from under the work t Unzips it.  Pulls out a short-barreled CAR-15 assault rif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no way of warning the surface.   Do you know what that means? Schoenick doesn't know.  He hopes Coffey knows.  Because  he's a fearless man who's discovering what it is to be af Coffey inserts the magazine with a CLACK!  Snaps the bolt.  Tosses the rifle to Schoenick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means... whatever happens is up  to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy passes the maintenance room.  Looks in.  The warhea and its cart are missing.  He looks around.  Heads toward the sub-bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The discussion, still in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they're from down there  originally?  Or from... you know. She jerks her thumb toward the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're from 'you know'.   Some place that has similar  conditions... cold, intense pressure.   No light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy as hogs in a waller down there,  prob'ly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy freezes in the corridor as he hears a loud ratcheti sound echoing from the sub-bay.  He edges forward slowly, trying to keep his feet silent on the steel floor.  Slide up along the wall next to the door.  Inches his eye aroun the doorframe.  Across the room. Schoenick is working wit chainfall, lowering Big Geek onto the MIRV warhead, which still on its cart.  He begins to attach them together wit sling of tie-down straps. Hippy lets his breath out slowly.  His expression is Holy Shit. He slides back along the corridor wall, silently.  Away f the door.  Then turn turns quickly to go... WHAM!  Coffey slams him up against the wall!  .45 pressed to Hippy's te Hippy gulping air as Coffey ears back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sniff something did you, rat boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting is breaking up as the door CLANGS open and Hi is thrusted inside.  His hands are taped behind his back he stumbles onto his face. Coffey steps through smoothly, straight-arming the .45.   Schoenick flanks him with the assault rifle aimed at the  group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREEZE!  Don't move.  That's it. (to Monk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, hold this a second.  We're  going to phase three.

He hands his gun to Monk, with the assumption of absolute loyalty from a team member.  Monk's eyes move between Cof and the pistol.  We can't tell what he's thinking.  Coffe grabs Hippy and shoves him onto a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're using Big Geek to take the  bomb to the NTIs!  We set it up to  go right to them. Lindsey looks stricken.  Her plan is betraying them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...  Oh no... (steps toward Coffey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, you can't.  Coffey, think  about what you're doing... for God's  sake-- Coffey lets her approach him, his eyes glittering. Without warning he grabs her by the hair and hurls her ag the Coke machine, pinning her there with one hand.  Bud l forward.

dialogues.speaker: GET BACK
dialogues.text: Bud freezes.  The rifle's muzzle is aimed for a heart-sho Coffey moves up close to Lindsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is something I've wanted to do  since I first met you. His hand reaches down, OUT OF FRAME.  We hear something R His hand comes back up... holding a piece of gaffer's tap He slaps it over her mouth.  Then pushes her down into a  chair. Hippy looks at Monk and Schoenick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boss is having a full-on  meltdown.  Guy's fixing to pull the  pin on fifty kilotons and we're all  ringside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the timer set for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  Don't talk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't get to minimum-safe-distance  in three hours.  The shockwave will  kill us.  It'll crush this rig like  a semi driving over a beer can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!  SHUT UP!  What's the matter  with you?! Everybody is twitching a hyper.  Schoenick is white-knuck his assault rifle... looking from Monk to Coffey to the g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stay calm.  The situation is  under control. Coffey backs out quickly with Schoenick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey dogs down the watertight door and wedges a piece o steel pipe into the mechanism so it can't be opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here. Schoenick take a position in front of the door.  Coffey t and runs through the corridor like demons are chasing him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their only hope is to sway Schoenick.  But the SEAL's fea is making him the perfect machine, totally dependent on  external orders.  And his orders are clear.  They can see him through the tiny window in the door.  Lindsey rips th tape painfully off her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schoenick... your Lieutenant is about  to make a real bad career move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy's crazier'n a shithouse  rat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to stop him!  Schoenick!!
They pound on the door.  Schoenick turns and hangs his ca over the tiny window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the chainfall, Coffey maneuvers the completed Geek/ package over the back of Flatbed, obviously preparing to the submersible to take it out and launch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey is up next to the door, with Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he's about to declare war on an  alien species, Schoenick, just when  they're trying to make contact with  us. (to Bud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm reaching him. There is a CLUNK-CLATTER and the door unlatches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? The door opens.  Jammer is standing there.  Schoenick is a heap against the far wall, moaning.  Jammer hands the r to Hippy as he walks in.  Hippy turns to cover the other  SEAL.  Monk puts his hands up, passively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the least of your problems. Bud appraises Jammer, who seems a little weak and dazed b basically okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  How you feeling, big guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figured I was dead, there, when I  seen that angel comin' toward me. They all look at him for a second.  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, okay, right.  You can tell us  about it later.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud drops down the ladder, INTO FRAME, followed by the ot He tries the door into the main corridor.  The wheel won' turn.  The others get on it.  Won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's jammed the mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what? They're locked in trimodule-C.  No other doors give acces to the sub-bay corridor.  Bud's mind is racing.  He drops down the ladder to Level One, into about two feet of wate He reaches down and open the emergency lockout hatch.  Ta off his boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm gonna free-swim to hatch  six... get inside, get the door open  from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, that water's only a couple  degrees above freezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess you better wish me luck,  huh? Catfish is pulling his boots off as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish us luck. (hands his wallet to  Hippy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Case I don't die.  Okay, Bud...  let's go, podner, I ain't got all  day. Bud clasps him on the shoulder and starts hyperventilatin He drops into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bed shoots down through the hatch.  The cold hits him lis fist, becoming instantly paralyzing.  He starts kicking i powerful strokes through the dark water, maneuvering arou tangles of umbilical cable twisted tubular steel. Catfish is behind him, swimming like hell.  They reach ha six.  Together they spin the wheel and heave upward, open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud surges up into the lock.  Catfish jams into the tiny  airspace with him. They try the upper hatch.  Jammed.  They're both panting  with the exertion and intense cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hafta... go on to... the moonpool.   Only way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... make it... podner. Bud looks at Catfish, shivering and heaving, wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Cat.  You head back. Bud hyperventilates rapidly and pikes over diving back ou through the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is stroking rapidly through the tangle of pipes and  conduit.  He sees the lit rectangle of the moonpool far a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the moonpool, Bud surface with an explosive gasp besid the Flatbed.  His wracked breathing is masked by the WHIN of HYDRAULICS as Coffey uses the external controls to ext Flatbed's big hydraulic arm, locking the Geek/MIRV in its gripper. Bud strokes to a point where Coffey can't see him and hea up out of the water onto the deck of the pool.  He lies  gasping behind Cab One's cradle. His limbs are wooden and unresponsive from the cold.  His fingers are completely numb.  He hugs himself, putting hi hands under his armpits. Scans the situation.  He can't get to the door, which is  across the room, without Coffey seeing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey watching the whole thing going down, ON THE SCREE a high angle of the sub bay... Bud moving up on Coffey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't get to the door... I think  he's going to try and take him  himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't be that dumb.  The guy's  a trained killer.  Bud's idea of a  fight is arm-wrestling One Night  over laundry duty. ON THE SCREEN, Bud picks up a piece of pipe.  Hefts it.   Moves forward, crouched... stalking.  Lindsey yells at th screen in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud chucks a tool across the chamber, creating a clatteri distraction, then wades in with the pipe in a vicious swi to the back of Coffey's knees, taking him down.  Coffey s even as he falls, catching Bud in a scissor kick that top him. Grappling, they fall together into the freezing water.  C is momentarily stunned by the cold, giving Bud time to ha himself out, hoping to make it to the door. Coffey launches from the water and grabs him legs. He pulls himself up as Bud kick out.  Claws his way vicio over Bud's body until he has him pinned to the deck.  The he pulls out the .45. Put it unceremoniously to Bud's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey pulls the trigger... CLICK.  Bud flinches, then op his eyes, staring cross-eyed at the muzzle of the .45.  C cocks it and tries again.  CLICK.  Nothing.  Really pisse off beyond description, Bud hurls the commando off him wi a powerful heave, sending him clattering against a rack o equipment.  They face off, panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rig crew turns from the screen at the sound of Monk's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tool the liberty of removing this  before I gave it back to him. Monk pulls his hand out from under his blanket and holds the magazine from the .45.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SUB WAY
dialogues.text: Even so Bud is getting his ass kicked.  Coffey's really t to put him out of business.  It's mostly duck and dodges Bud's part.  Throw a few things. When Coffey connects, Bud goes down hard.  Give him credi though.  He manages to scramble back up. The fight wrecks the room, scattering tools and gear. Compressed air cylinders roll dangerously around the floo Coffey slips on one and Buds get in a couple of good lick Slams the SEAL's head in an equipment locker door. But the Navy man is just too massive.  Bud is hammered ba into a wall. Coffey has his fist cocked back for the coup de grace.  S around at the sound of a VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Catfish is right behind him.  Dripping wet.  A trail of w goes back to the moonpool a few feet away. CRACK!  Catfish's 'Hammer' punch comes in so hard and so  fast, Coffey is knocked right on his ass.  He doesn't get up.  Just sort of flops around. Catfish helps Bud to his feet.  They advance on Coffey, w crab-scuttles sideways, his eyes rabid. He picks up a helium tank and hurls it at them.  As they  duck he sprints to Flatbed and drops through the hatch an slams it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Catfish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the door! Bud leaps across the water to land on Flatbed.  The hatch already sealed. He grapples with Geek/MIRV, trying to free it from the st claw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey crawls along the access tunnel to the pilot's  compartment.  He claws his way into the control seat and  starts rapidly flipping switches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish pounds down the corridor like he's never run befo his beer gut doing a rumba.  He reaches the door, tears o the piece of pipe and spins the wheel.  Hippy pushes it o so fast it hits Catfish in the stomach. Hippy tears past him, running with the assault rifle.  Jo Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flatbed is submerging, with only the hatch tower still ab the water.  Bud is being dragged down, still trying to fr the ROV.  He gives up when he sees Hippy run in, waving t assault rifle around like a 130-pound Rambo. Bud climbs the hatch tower and leaps to the deck of the  moonpool. Hippy clumsily raises the unfamiliar rifle at Coffey, vis inside his viewing bubble beneath the swirling water.  Co looks up, stares at the gun... doesn't seem to care.

dialogues.speaker: SHOOT
dialogues.text: Hippy's squeezing the trigger and nothing's happening.   Flatbed's hatch tower goes under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safety's on!  On the side... the  lever!  Up, push it up! Hippy fumble with the selective-fire lever, BLAM-BLAM-BLA He put three quick rounds into the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that!! He grabs it out of Hippy's hands and aims it at the sub. racks the water with a long burst.  BENEATH THE SURFACE, rounds nip nasty contrails through the water.  They barel scar the front port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget that... go for Big Geek! Catfish rakes the descending sub with more bursts, trying hit the shimmering shape of the ROV on its back.  UNDERWA we see the rounds arcing wild, a few hitting the ROV but  causing little damage. Coffey complete his descent to just above the seafloor.   ABOVE, Catfish empties the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a hand! They all turn.  Bud is fumbling into his wetsuit like a  madman.  The others rush over to help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the rest of my gear.  Grab that  hat there...  let's go guys!  Come  on, come on! Catfish slams a backpack onto Bud's shoulders, grappling  with the straps and hose connections.  Hippy and Sonny (w one hand) are clipping, zipping and buckling all over him This is a world-record suit-up time.  Bud pulls the rubbe neck-dam of the helmet's lower ring down over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helmet... helmet!  Work fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the habitat, Coffey is maneuvering Flatbed throug the twisted pipe and debris left by Deepcore's slide to t edge.  Bloodied, his fatigues ripped half-off, he looks l a feral animal.  His eyes burn with the determination of mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jammer expertly works the crane controls, moving Cab One over the moonpool from its drydock cradle.
Lindsey and One Night are scrambling like monkeys over th port side crash bars of the swinging sub, clambering up t the hatch tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll unhook. (Lindsey hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO!  You're better in these than I  am. Lindsey recognizes this for what it is... a sign of respe a reconciliation.  She nods and drops through the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey passes under the twisted wreckage of the big autom derrick and makes a tight turn beneath the drill-floor mo Flatbed scrapes through between twisted conduit, metal  screeching on metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud has his 'hat' locked down and his air cut on.  He tak two quick strides to the edge of the pool and just drops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud rockets DOWN INTO FRAME in a column of bubbles.  He l around.  Through the lattice of conduit under the rig he see Flatbed moving forward from its exit point under the  stern.  Bud see a shortcut under the platform. He kicks along a lattice of pipes, heaving himself along frantic hand-over-hand stokes.  He reaches for Flatbed's  stern as it passes. Misses the last hand-hold... but just manages to seize a down trailing behind it.  He is jerked along behind the s Bud holds on with both hands as he is buffeted in the wak of the powerful thrusters.  Flatbed gathers speed, moving out toward the edge of the abyssal wall.  The current sla him, spinning him like a fishing lure.  He pulls himself  forward slowly until he can grip the stern rail of Flatbe platform. LOW ANGLE, look up the wall.  Flatbed appears over the ed and stops. Hovering. ON THE BACK OF FLATBED.  Bud has the break he needs.  He  scrambles up onto the deck and opens an equipment locker. Nothing in it but one of the yellow nylon safety lines.
The big arm begins to unfold, lifting Geek/ROV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey works intently.  His eyes are the cool ice of leth madness in a face streaked with blood.  He brings the ROV into view with the boom arm. GEEK/ROV has a passenger.  Brigman.  The diver is holding Geek's skid with one hand, doing something with the other He turns to look at Coffey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey releases the ROV with the gripper and makes a grab Bud with the steel claw.  Bud dives.  The gripper hits hi helmet a glancing blow.  Bud kicks away rapidly, letting  nylon rope pay out.  We see he has managed to tie one end Geek's skids.  Coffey hits the button to activate the ROV sending an acoustic pulse to Geek's transponder.  The lit robot, pregnant with its load of death, turns nimbly arou and dives out and down toward the void. Coffey pivots his big machine toward Bud.  Bud strokes ra to a large jumble of wreckage.  He loops the rope around twisted pipe.  Big Geek is hauling ass away from him.  Th line snap taut an instant later.  The ROV strains, like a Rottweiler on a leash... trying to go.  The rope is slipp as Bud fights to make a knot. Flatbed slews around, thrusters whining.  As it banks, it hurls up clouds of sediment from the escarpment face. Through the front panel we see Coffey jerking on the cont The big arm extends menacingly.  The smaller from manipul open.  An enormous predatory insect, its lights blaring. The big machine roars forward.  Straight at Bud. Bud gets his knot partly done.  See Flatbed looming. Glare-lit in its lights, Bud grabs a handhold and pulls  himself downward as Coffey closes the last few feet. One manipulator slams into his backpack, tumbling him, an the sub's underside rakes across his legs as it passes ov Flatbed crushes into the tangle of pipework.  K-CRUUUNCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffey is slammed hard over the controls, up into the fro dome port.  He gets back in the seat.  Strains to free hi machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud swims clear, diving down at an angle along the wall,  hoping to stay in Coffey's blind area.  Flatbed backs out the wreckage in a cloud of debris. It pivots toward Bud.  Moves after him. Nearby, the ROV is whining mindlessly, trying to please. Trying to GO. DETAIL OF ROPE attached to wreckage, as Bud's knot begins slip.  The nylon line starts to play through the knot slo BUD has gotten himself into a bad position.  Along the ba rock face of the cliff wall he is naked, nailed in the  spotlights like a rabbit in front of a truck.  Coffey put the hammer down, thrust levers all the way forward. Flatbed surges forward, multi-limbed and demonic.  There' no cover, side to side, up or down. Coffey has him head in his lights.  Suddenly a bright gla blasts in, blinding Coffey.  He looks up to see Cab One  rushing down upon him, full throttle. At the last moment LIndsey slams the thrusters full-lock the submersible slews sideways, slamming its heavy skidpl into Flatbed's cab.  Coffey is smashed sideways by the sh He fights to control his vehicle.  Lindsey looks up to se Coffey's sub gun it up over the wall, out of sight.  She  cruises up over Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in! Bud gets the lockout hatch open and clambers up into Cab  One's belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud flops over the lip of the hatch and slams it shut.  H ditches his helmet. Lindsey raises her vehicle warily above the wall.  Throug the front port there is no sign of Coffey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me one, Virgil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we negotiate later?  There's Big  Geek.

He points.  Through the front port, they can see the ROV  still straining at its leash.  Lindsey dives toward it,  simultaneously working the controls to open her own small manipulator claws. 185   EXT. DEEPCORE/WALL, ETC. The last few feet of the rope slip through the knot. Big Geek happily surges forward.  It dives gracefully dow into the void, trailing the yellow rope like a kite tail. ONE CAB ONE, Bud and Lindsey through the front port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go after it!  We gotta catch it! FLATBED DROPS INTO FRAME BEHIND THEM, dwarfing little Cab One.  They are slammed viciously as Coffey's submersible  hammers into them.  She hits full throttle.  Coffey floor it after Lindsey, ramming her from behind with his more  powerful vehicle.  With difficulty Lindsey maintains trim She arcs back toward the rig.  Flatbed slams her again, f the side.  She fights for control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is tossed around, ricocheting off the walls.  Lindsey flies with her jaw set.  Fighting hard for control.  The frame of the rig looms before her. She shoots through at full throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the fight is really on.  The two subs are dodging bet the cylindrical modules at full throttle, slamming into e other and the steel pressure hulls. Coffey sideswipes the smaller sub, jamming it sideways. screeches along the flank of one of the trimodules. They head out over empty terrain in a flat-out speed run. Lindsey is jinking and dodging as Flatbed, roars along be her, tearing up the bottom with its powerful backwash.  Lindsey carves hard around a rock pinnacle, finding herself running para to the edge of the abyssal canyon. Coffey is ramming, hammering from behind, then from side side.

Lindsey snarls.  He's pissing her off.  He shouldn't do t Ahead, out of the blackness, another outcropping. Lindsey rises, cuts right. Smashes down into Coffey's craft.  Timing it just right. skids catch in the rocks. Flatbed slews violently, nosing down.  Crushing into the  rocky bottom. Pressing the advantage, Lindsey hammers into Flatbed from behind. It smashes full force into a second spire, spinning out o control. Tangles together, the subs slide down an embankment towar the edge of the wall.  With her one remaining thruster sh jerks clear of Flatbed and grounds her crippled sub.  Fla tumbles over the edge. ANGLE DOWN THE WALL as it falls, trailing a cloud of sedi like a comet's tail, down into the unfathomable blackness below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the machine, Coffey is fighting for control. He has no buoyancy or motors and the craft continues its plunge.  As the pressure intensifies the hull begins to g and steel fitting scream with the enormous load. A tiny silver fracture shoots partway across the front bu Grows. Coffey gives up fighting.  Just stares, wide eyed, at his death.  A damned soul dropping into the bottomless pit. The fracture line arcs rapidly across the dome port. Suddenly, a scythe-like curtain of seawater, under tons o pressure, slashes into him.  A moment later the bubble  implodes, and Coffey disappears in a bloody froth of chur water, air and glass shards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flatbed looks like a toy, tumbling away down the wall. Soon its lights vanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both going to have a lot of bruises... Lindsey is surveying the damage.  Water is spraying down them like a shower, and lights are flickering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did okay, back there.  I was  fairly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good enough.  We still gotta  catch Big Geek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in this thing. Lindsey is flipping switches.  Nothing works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You totaled it, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  So sue me. Bud looks down.  There's already about a foot of water  sloshing around the floor at their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's flooding like a son of the bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You noticed. She picks up and hand-mike of the underwater telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deepcore, Deepcore, this is Cab One,  over. She waits.  No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deepcore, this is Cab One.  We need  assistance, over.  Deepcore, this-- With a SEARING CRACKLE or arc-light, a power panel shorts out and everything goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful. (looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some light from somewhere... A faint illumination, dimmer than moonlight, washes in th the front port. Lindsey scrunches up against the acrylic and scans the  darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there.  It's the rig. A glow, beyond a rock promontory... like the lights of a  town just over the hill in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good hundred yards, I'd say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll come out after us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's gonna take them a  while to find us.  We better get  this flooding stopped. He picks up his helmet and clicks on the light.  Using th thing like a bulky flashlight.  The water is really pouri in, spraying them like a shower...  almost two feet deep  already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see where it's coming in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere behind this panel.  Hold  this. She takes the light and he tries to reach the burst weld, which is blocked by a steel switch panel and a bunch of  conduit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't get to it.  Have to pull this  panel off.  You go any tools?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, look around.
Bud scans the cramped interior, feels around under the wa It's past his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Son of a bitch.  All I  need's a goddamn crescent wrench. He grabs the panel in both hands and starts torquing on i trying to wrench it off the wall.  Heaves on it repeatedl Finally stops, panting.  He's breathing hard now, and it' not just effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Bud. A nervous edge in her voice now.  Bud's turning all aroun looking around for anything, trying to think fast.  Water to their waists.  The sea closing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... okay.  We gotta get you out  of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've only got one suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!  I know!  But we better come  up with something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaargh!!  I'm freezing! She climbs up on the pilots seat, scrunching right up aga the ceiling, keeping as much of herself as possible out o the frigid water.  She's shaking all over with the cold, getting drenched from above by water pouring in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, look, you swim to the rig and  come back with another suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven, eight minute swim each way...  not enough time.  Look at this... (the rate of flooding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time I get back you'll be-- That stops the conversation for a second.  About two feet airspace left. Bud can't believe what this is coming down to.  They both stare at each other for a long moment. He makes a decision.  Starts pulling off his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, put this on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
