dialogues.text: What, you growing gills all of a  sudden?  You got it on, keep it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't argue, goddamnit, just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way!  Forget it.  Not an option. Bud has his pack off uncoupling it.  She keeps fighting h hands, stopping him, hooking it back up.  The desperation the situation fuel the struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey, just put the thing on and  shut up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!!  Now be logical, Bud, you're--

dialogues.speaker: FUCK LOGIC
dialogues.text: They're both right up against the ceiling, water up to th chests. Lindsey's lips are blue and trembling from the cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... will you listen to me for  a second!?  You've got the suit on  and you're a better swimmer than me.   Right?  So I got a plan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drown, you tow me back to the rig--

dialogues.speaker: WHAT KIND OF PLAN IS THAT
dialogues.text: Lindsey's gut-scared... shaking violently, her eyes wide. But she's keeping it together.  Thinking it out.  Bud see the bottomless pit opening to take her and he can barely  think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this water is only a couple  degrees above freezing.  I drown.  I  go into deep hypothermia...  my blood  like icewater.  I can maybe be revived  after ten, fifteen minutes.  You got  all the stuff to do it on the rig. Bud stops moving and looks into her face, inches from him The water is up to their necks.  He knows that, as always infuriatingly, Lindsey is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way, Bud.  Now trust  me. She takes a deep breath.  Before her nerve fails she busi her hands on his suit, rehooking everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I don't believe this is  happening. She raise his helmet.  Water up to their chins.  They loc eyes, inches apart.  He can feel her breath on his face.. maybe for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Lins... I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me later. He grabs her head in both hands and pulls her mouth to hi They lock together in a fierce kiss, fueled by passion an terror... the naked realization of love hanging over the  abyss of death. She breaks away at the last possible second and quickly p his helmet over his head.  Seats is down over the neck ri
Lock the bail-out handle, sealing it.  Even with her head pressed up into the highest point of the ceiling, Lindsey mouth is barely above water.  She give a scared little la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is maybe not such a great plan,  is it? She is half-paralyzed with the cold, shaking pathetically Puts her face to the glass of his helmet.  Seconds to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold me.  Hold me, Bud... I'm so  scared... He can't hear her, but he read her lips.  They clutch eac other desperately. The embrace last while the water rises over her mouth and nose.  She starts to choke.  Her hands grip his shoulders like claws.  She bucks and thrashes. Bud holds her, and a scream tears loose from him, a pure  agony of the soul.

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOO
dialogues.text: The freezing seawater races into her lungs.  Her finger g slack, and her hands float lifelessly. Bud stares, transfixed, as the last tiny bubble trickles of Lindsey's open mouth.  He kicks himself into gear, fin frenzied as he spins the wheel of the lockout hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON VIDEO SCREEN, one of the outside cameras.  A gho figure swims out of the darkness, towing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Bud.  Oh my God... that's  Lindsey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deepcore, Deepcore, do you read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read you, Bud.  We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud swims with long, powerful kicks, towing Lindsey.  Her arms and legs float as gracefully as seaweed waving in a  gentle current.  Bud's voice comes in short rasps, breath hard, but icy with control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the infirmary... get the cart...  oxygen...  de-fib kit... adrenaline  in a... ten cc syringe... and some...  heating blankets.  You got all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me in the moonpool.  Move fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door crashes open and Jammer thunders in.  He picks u the CPR cart, meant to roll on wheels, and carries it out past Hippy, Catfish, and One Night, who are crowding in t get the rest of the equipment.  They ransack the place in about ten seconds, grabbing everything they might need an half of everything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud moves up toward the rectangle of light, towing Lindse to the diving platform.  Through the surface we can see t others arrive at the edge, looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hippy and Catfish are setting up the cart and the oxygen  kit, dropping things, making mistakes.  One Night is teac herself how to fill a syringe from a bottle of adrenaline

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he comes! Jammer and Sonny leap into the freezing water, waist deep the submerged diving platform.  Bud bursts to the surface Together they haul Lindsey across the platform, out of th water, and onto the deck.  Her skin is blue-white, her ch still. Bud rips his helmet off in a near-frenzy, like a man  possessed, a man with a mission.  The others are galvaniz by his energy even though they all see Lindsey as dead, a corpse... cold and inert.  Water flows from her mouth and nose and her lips are blue, her limbs completely limp.
Hippy peels back one eyelid, to find the pupil fixed and  dilated. But when Bud shouts for them to move, they move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn her over! They flip his wife's body over.  He straddles her, pushin down with both hands in the middle of her back.  Seawater gushes from her slack lips.  He does it again until the f stops, then flips her onto her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, hurry!  Gimme the de-fib... One Night and Catfish are fumbling with the emergency car equipment.  They've all been trained in CPR and use of th gear but that was years ago, and this is a friend they're working on.  They're all thumbs.  Catfish drops the  electrodes, picks them up quickly, hands them to Bud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, here, here... no, you got to  have bare skin, or it won't... Bud rips into her clothing, opening her jumpsuit, literal tearing away her T-shirt, revealing her bare chest... bon and still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  Gimme those, come on.   Catfish, move it, man!  Come on...  come on! He slaps the things into Lindsey's bare skin, one on the  sternum and one on the side of the rib cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that it?  Is this right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  I mean, I don't know... it  looks right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Do it! One Night hits the switch and Lindsey's body convulses. is a pure muscle reflex, and when it is over, there is no hint of life.  Hippy pushes him back and puts a black rub oxygen mask over her mouth.  He opens the valve on the  cylinder and starts pumping the squeeze bag.
They start packing electronic blankets around her to figh the intense hypothermia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it again, One Night.  Zap her  again! The current hits Lindsey again and her back arches.  Bud  doesn't wait for a result... he's in his own reality now, driven.  He's doing it all at once, somehow, in a sensele frenzy... pumping on her chest with his hands, squeezing oxygen bag, placing the electrodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw.  Christ... come on, baby.  Again!   Do it again! Lindsey's back arches.  Her body relaxes, inert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, One Night... what are you  waiting for? A hush seems to have fallen over the group.  They know  instinctively that it's over.  But Bud can't accept it. looks at them, beseechingly, like they are somehow  intentionally holding out on him.  One Night starts to cr quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, it's over, man.  It's over. There is a beat of silence.  Bud stares down into Lindsey half-open, motionless eyes. TIGHT ON LINDSEY'S EYES, moving in until the pupil FILLS  FRAME, a black void. REVERSE, HER POV.  SILENCE.  A distant, distorted image, see Bud, One Night, Jammer, Hippy, Catfish, staring down. It is like the circular top of a dark well, their faces  shimmering as if through the surface of water.  It is as we are in a well, descending, looking up at a circle of f growing smaller as we drop away... smaller and smaller,  receding until it becomes a point of light in the void, l the fading bright dot at the center of a turned-off TV. TIGHT ON BUD, rigid, staring.  Catfish puts his hand gent on Bud's shoulder. Suddenly Bud tears Catfish's hand away and sets upon Lind like a madman, renewing his efforts in spades... totally  manic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  NO!  She's not... her heart is  strong, she wants to live... can't  you see that?  Come on, Lins.  Come  on, baby!  Zap her again!  Do it...

dialogues.speaker: DO IT
dialogues.text: They do.  And Bud works, feverishly.  He lock his lips ov hers and starts mouth-to-mouth.  It is frantic, passionat the kiss of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, breath!  Goddamn it, you  bitch, you never backed down from  anything in life... now fight! He slaps her face, hard.  Her head lolls.  He smacks her other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight, Goddamnit! LINDSEY's POV, from the bottom of the great well.  The ci of faces and light rockets toward us in the blackness, as soar upward from the pit.  We see Bud yelling, but his vo is distant, windlike.

dialogues.speaker: FIGHT
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON LINDSEY, still.  Then something incredible happe Something they will never forget as long as they live.   Lindsey coughs once, weakly, and her hands clench in a sp Bud see it and his expression becomes beatific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Lins.  You can do it...  fight your way back, baby... The others look on in wonder as Bud wills this woman back She starts to cough, weakly at first... then more violent as she draws air into her lungs.  Bud crouches over her,  rubbing her limbs... trying to re-establish circulation. is like a difficult birth.  Lindsey comes hacking and how back into the world, wet and naked and fighting for breat Bud puts the oxygen mask over her face and she draws brea after agonized breath.  He pushes her wet hair back from face with his trembling hands, and watches her breathe.   Color is returning to her skin as she lies there, gasping weakly.
ONE THE GROUP... Catfish, Hippy, One Night, Jammer, the  others... they're all grinning, crying, beaming... gazing the miracle of her rebirth. ON BUD... tears are streaming down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper, fierce  and harsh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it, ace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON LINDSEY, sleeping peacefully.  WIDER shows Bud  hovering over her, attentive.  They are alone in Bud's ti cubicle.  Perhaps twenty minutes have passed.  She is  completely swaddles in blankets, except for her face, and looks like a waif. Lindsey's eyes flutter and open.  The first thing she see is Bud, bending over her.  He can't help himself.  The te break again and roll down his cheeks.  She seems terribly fragile, but bright and aware.  She smiles, faintly... to his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... big boys don't cry, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, tough guy.  I guess it worked,  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course is worked.  You're never  wrong, are you?  How d'you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been better.  Next time it's  your turn, okay? Bud's expression turn inexplicably grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you got that right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON BUD'S EYES, as Monk's fingers insert acrylic scl lenses under his eyelids so he can see in the fluid helme WIDER reveals Bud is wearing the SEALs' deep suit.  Every is grouped around, buckling and zipping.  He is  hyperventilating with an oxygen mask, part of the procedu for transitioning from air to fluid breathing.  Monk, on stretcher, is presiding.  The resident expert.  Lindsey i wrapped in a blanket, still looking wan and frail.  She  doesn't have the strength to resist Bud's will, but she's trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Bud, no... not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who then? She looks around at the others.  Sees their eyes.  The fe Has her answer. He lowers the helmet over his head.  Catfish clamps it do We see what's riving him... his sense of responsibility f these people, for not being able to prevent this situatio He touches her cheek, one last time.  She sees his finger are trembling. Then he puts on the gloves.  Catfish is strapping a KEYPA UNIT onto Bud's forearm.  Lindsey wants to scream... to s this madness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'll hear you, but I can't talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fluid prevents your larynx from  making sound.  It'll feel a little  strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warning you now, folks, I'm a lousy  typist. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment of truth, huh? His breathing is shallow and tense.  He looks at Lindsey. The eyes of a condemned man.  She squeezes his hand.  He  takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Let's rock and roll.
Monk gently cracks a valve on the suit's feed line.  The  breathing fluid (3M fluorocarbon emulsion FX-80) swirls i the helmet.  Bud reflexively raises his chin.  The liquid fills toward his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax now, Bud.  Just keep breathing  as it fills... don't fight it.  Take  it in.  Just let yourself take it  in. Suddenly, there's nothing in there to breathe but liquid. His eyes go wide, instant panic.  He starts to thrash.  C heaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold him.  Hold him.  This is  normal... it'll pass in a second.   You're gonna be okay.  We all breathe  liquid for nine months, Bud.  Your  body will remember. Lindsey grabs Bud's shoulders, steadying him.  He finds h eyes, the look calming him.  He's passed into a realm fro which she has already returned. His spasms subside.  He begins to "breathe" normally.  He gets a goofy look of wonder on his face, not really belie what he's experiencing.  He is alive, alert and quite  completely drowned inside the FBS helmet.  He grins. Gives a big thumbs up.  Lindsey picks up a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me okay? (another thumbs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try your keypad. Bud taps out a brief message.  FEELS WEIRD - YOU SHOULD T THIS prints out on their portable monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already have, moron. They help Bud to the edge of the dive platform.  Jammer a Hippy lower Little Geek into the water and Bud grabs onto it.  Hippy yells right up next to his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I redid Little Geek's chip the same  as Big Geek!  He should take you  right to it.  All you gotta do is  hang on!
Lindsey crouches at the edge to watch Bud submerge. He looks up at her as he drops away. In a few seconds, she can't see him.  Her chin quivers,  minutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM FAR BELOW, Deepcore is a faint tiara of lights, abov in the blackness. A single moving light appears above, at the edge of the c and starts down.  It grows large, resolving into Bud, fre falling down the wall. He gathers speed as Little Geek's vertical thruster drive them down. Bud looks down.  Between his feet he can see a short way  down the wall in the glow of his single light, and beyond that an unfathomable blackness.  The wall unrolls upwards out of the darkness like a convoluted gray drapery.  He l up.  The lights of Deepcore are gone.  He feels  more alo than he has ever felt.  He types out:  CANT SEE YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're right here with you, Bud.   Your depth is 3800 feet.  You're  doing fine. Bud comes upon the twisted wreckage of the crane, hanging against the wall like a forty-ton yo-yo at the end of the umbilical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is grouped around the monitor screen, watching B telemetry.  Bud types out: GOOD DEAL ON SLIGHTLY USED CRA They watch the depth meter counting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4800 feet.  It's official.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, according to Monk here, you  just set a record for the deepest  suit dive.  Bet you didn't think  you'd be doing this when you got up  this morning. The screen print out:  CALL GUINESS.  They laugh.  So far good.  Seconds later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One mile down and still grinnin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT.  Bud is a tiny spider dropping down the wall i pathetic little pool of light.  The wall is sterile brown gray, devoid of life at this depth. LOOKING DOWN, as the light shrinks to a star and vanishes the blackness yawning below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey has the microphone gripped tightly, and the light in her voice is a bit brittle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8500 feet, Bud.  Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him about pressure effects.   Tremors, vision problems, euphoria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ensign Monk want to know how you  feel. ON THE SCREEN, printing out: COLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big baby. Then:  HANDS SHAKING.  HHARD TO TYPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's starting.  It hits the nervous  system first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep talking, Lindsey.  Just let him  hear your voice.  It doesn't matter  what about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget Bud, you're being graded  on spelling as well as sentence  structure, so concentrate, okay? (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, I... uh, there's some things I  want to say. It's hard for me.  I'm  not of those softy, gooey-center- type people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not easy, you know, being a  cast-iron bitch.  It takes discipline  and years of training.  A lot of  people don't appreciate that. Lindsey has somehow tuned out the others in the room.  In her mind she is with Bud, out in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But is wasn't all bad.  I know that.   You remember that bike trip... we  rode the Honda up through Oregon?   It took me a week to get my hair  untangled, but I've never been  happier.  It was the most... free...  I've ever felt.  I'm sorry I can't  tell you these things to your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is visibly trembling, gritting his teeth... holding o as the vise-grip of pressure takes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pitiful.  I have to wait until  you're freezing in the dark and  there's ten thousand feet of water  between us.  I guess I'm babbling.   I'm sorry. Bus struggles with his keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Somehow's she's smiling and on the verge of tears at the  same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two miles down and still grinnin'   Comin' up on the big ten thou'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom's still a mile and a half  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM!  Bud jerks as his dive light implodes.  He still ha Geek's floodlights. He falls on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12000 feet.  Jesus, I don't believe  he's doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Hippy.  Bud, how you doing? He types: SE LUMINUS THINNGS Everyone snaps suddenly aler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of luminous things, Bud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's... you know... them. The screen prints out:  ITS OK. SQUID. GLOWING SQUID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bus is in an enormous school of bioluminescent squid,  graceful, attenuated creatures less than a foot long.   Thousands of then glide in ghostly arcs around him, filli the black void as far as the eye can see.  He stares at t in wonder.  Reaches out and touches one, catches it, lets go.  Are they really here?  He can no longer be sure of h own perceptions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another message from Bud:  THINK THEYR REAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's losing it.  Talk to him.  Keep  him with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, it's the pressure.  Try to  concentrate.  Concentrate on my voice.   Just listen to my voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud emerges from the school of squid.  As he falls, they  form a luminous plane of swirling colors above him.  He s upwards, transfixed.  BUD'S POV, the ghostly blizzard of  luminescence above him.  A spectral form takes shape in t patternless glow... resolving into Lindsey's face, a hund feet wide.  Gazing down at him, her expression sad.
Her image receded away from him into the darkness above a he falls. DOWN ANGLE ON BUD, reaching up in anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey watches as Bud haltingly types out:  YOUR GOING A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going away, Bud.  I'm right  here, right here with you.  This is  Lindsey, Bud.  I'm right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signal's fading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing juice... kill everything  we don't need.  Catfish, knock out  those lights. Everyone hustles to comply.  The room is plunged into  darkness, the faces of the group lit only by the ghostly screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run it through the digital processor,  cook it as much as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventeen thousand feet.  Good Christ  Almighty, this is insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is shaking violently, as if with palsy.  His eyes kee rolling back, and he's having a hard time staying conscio He tries to type a message and he can't.  The tons of pre per square inch are short-circuiting his nervous system. Suddenly K-BAM!  Little Geek's pressure hull implodes.  I lights go out.  BLACKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Geek just folded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, little buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can still make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how alone you feel... alone  in all that cold blackness... but  I'm there in the dark with you, Bud  you're not alone... Lindsey seems not to be in the room, but to be with him,  seeing what he sees. She is oblivious to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackness.  Then a bright light appears... he's lit a  MAGNESIUM FLARE. It's fierce, flickering glare lights his plunge.  Bud dis the stalwart little ROV and free-falls like a skydiver wi a chute.  Out of control, he hits a ledge and rolls off. Tumbles forward in a cloud of debris.  He hits another  outcropping, limp as a rag doll.  Rocks and sand rain dow with him as he continues his descent. Bud us quivering, teeth locked in a titanic rigor. He pulls his arms and legs slowly into a fetal position. In the plunge toward death he has gone he has gone full  circle, returned to the womb in which we all breathe the  water of life before we know the world of air and light. Still, there is Lindsey's voice, faintly in his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember that time, you were  pretty drunk, you probably don't  remember... the power went out at  the old apartment, the one on Orange  Street... and we were staring at  that one little candle, and I said  something really dumb like that candle  is me, like every one of us is out  there alone in the dark in this  life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON LINDSEY as she grips the microphone.  Her voice become a hoarse whisper.  Her eyes are intense, focused o point far beyond the walls of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and you lit another candle and  put it beside mine and said "that's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: me"... and we stared at the two  candles, and then we... well, if you  remember any of it, I'm sure you  remember the next part.  Bud, there  are two candles in the dark.  I'm  with you.  I'll always be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny flickering light moves down along a vast black wal Bud falls on in ream-like solitude, a candle in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catfish gently takes the microphone from Lindsey's hands leans close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin', podner?  Still with  us, come-back?  Talk to us, Buddy  boy. They watch the screen, expectantly. Nothing.  Hippy and One Night start checking the equipmen Lindsey tried unsuccessfully to keep the terror our of he voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud?  You hangin' in there?  Talk to  me, Bud.  Are you okay? There is an agonizing pause, then the letters appear slow SHAKING STOPED. FEEL BETER.  SOM LITE BELOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hallucinating badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is no longer in pain.  His expression is rapt. LOOKING DOWN, past his to a ghostly landscape.  His last  flare sputters out, but there is light.  Bioluminescent a carpet the walls of the canyon below him.  And he's right it is beautiful.

The water is so clear we can see down 500 feet past Bud's tiny, silhouetted figure, to a vast landscape faintly rev in spectral pastels.  Barren as the moon but exquisite,  serene.  Changeless.  A place unseen by human eyes. Like a firefly below, the lights of Big Geek are visible. Bud descends toward the ROV, which has grounded on a narr shelf.  Below the shelf, the wall slopes out, suggesting are near the bottom of the canyon but can't see it. ON BIG GEEK/MIRV, sitting there like a dumbshit.  Bud's f thump into the sediment next to it, stirring it luminous  particles.  Touchdown... three and half miles of water ov his head.  Bud leans over the warhead in a swarm of firef

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT GEEK prints out.  Monk takes the headset gently from  Lindsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Bud, we'll go step by step.   Take the cover plate off the firing  box. A long pause.  Then... PLATE OFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Bud, you have to cut the  ground wire, not the lead wire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is peering into the detonator unit.  How bad is he? can't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the blue wire with the white  stripe, not... I repeat... NOT the  black wire with the yellow stripe. Bud is staring.  Blinking.  The two wire look big as sewe pipes, and they're miles away... way down there where his hands are. The only light he has left is a CYALUME STICK.  He pulls the little plastic tube.  Breaks and shakes.  It starts t glow, a tiny wand of green light.  He fumbles with his to pouch, takes out a pair of side-cutters. CUTING NNOW he types to them.  He reaches into the detona DETAIL, THE WIRES... in the green Cyalume glow, the look  identical.  The cutters go over on wire.  A long beat.
They withdraw, then go over the other wire... He cuts--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is frozen.  Waiting.  It's very quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would we see the flash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through three miles of water?   I  don't know. They're holding their breaths.  Then... STILL HERE.  A ch goes up.  Rebel yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, quiet!  Save you air,  goddamnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, give me a reading off your liquid  oxygen gauge. TEN MINUTES WORTH ID SAY.  Lindsey goes white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took him over an hour to get down  there-- It's hopeless.  Lindsey grabs the headset from Monk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop you weights and start back now!   The gauge could be wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bus is one his knees beside the dead warhead.  His expres is enigmatic. He looks around slowly at the luminous canyon.  Starts to type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message comes in:  NO.  THINK ILL STAY A WHILE.  BEAU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You can make it!  You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your weights... you... can  breathe shallow... you...  it could  be wrong-- Lindsey's voice has twisted into a sob.  She begins to we quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Virgil, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.  Then the words...

dialogues.speaker: BUT YOU KNOW I HAD TO COME.
dialogues.text: Lindsey sobs at the mike.  The others look away.  The sig is weakening. One Night boosts it and the screen clears briefly. LOVE YOU WIFE. She stares at the printout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you. There is no reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny figure lies slumped beside the inert ROV, an India dying with his horse in the desert. Bud's eyelids close.  His chest barely moving. A strange illumination bathes his face and his eyes open. He blinks.  Weakly, he raises his head, facing the source the radiance. BUD'S POV... A glowing figure hovers before him, like a  vision.  It seems to be an angel.  Seen closer, as it dri toward him, we see that it is an extraterrestrial being,  bioluminescent like some deep-sea fish.  Its body and lim are transparent, and it resembles a figure made of blown  glass.  A delicate mantle or veil billows out around its  like a corona, which pulsates gently, propelling the bein with the hypnotic grace of a Spanish dancer.  The head is refined and strangely anthropomorphic, with large eyes th convey a cold, dispassionate wisdom.

It is stunningly beautiful. The creature settles toward him.  Unafraid, Bud extends h hand. Its slender, blown-glass digits grasp his bulky glove.  I pulls him up from the benthic ooze and they glide togethe down the slope, deeper into the abyss. At the limits of visibility we see faint, glowing forms m below.  They resolve into NTI ships.  Tiny ovoids, like t little scoutship that Lindsey nearly collided with at the Montana wreck.  The larger manta-ships.  And others, stra configured, moving in the darkness below like luminous fi Suddenly the darkness explodes with light.  A vast,  reticulated pattern of brightly glowing lines, like some  enormous circuit diagram, appears below them, covering th floor of the abyssal trench.  It sweeps outward from the  center, as if the light were surging through channels.  T NTIs are revealing their home to Bud.  The ships move amo the spires like air traffic over a major city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud and the creature descend until, between the lines of  light, we see a dark surface of inhuman design.  The shap extends beyond the limits of visibility. Towers hundreds of feet high stretch upward from the curv surface.  It warfs their figures as the descend toward it approaching an opening that soon yawns like a vast mouth. They are picking up speed, swept along by a powerful curr into the mouth-like opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bus stares around in awe as smooth, pearlescent walls blu past him.  It is a curving three-dimensional maze of tunn like a vast circulatory system, where controlled currents water become freeways in three-dimensional space.  Tunnel divide, narrow, and reenter main-routes hundreds of feet  across, as the pair race through in a dizzying blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering a smaller chamber they settle to the floor, and NTI moves back a few feet. A shimmering plane or surface appears like a vertical cur bisecting the chamber.  The seawater divides, like the Re Sea, into two rippling walls.

They move apart.  Leaving Bud standing in a short, shimme hallway.  Weakly, he uncouples his helmet and pulls it fr Drops to his knees.  Doubles over as spasms wrack him.   Breathing fluid explodes from his lungs.  He lies gasping and coughing on the floor, dragging in deep breaths of wh he can only hope is air.  It is. Bud slowly recovers, sitting up.  His head is clearing.   This really is happening.  Beyond the shimmering, vertica surface of the water he sees the NTI being joined by othe move or less identical, until a group of seven is gathere watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, Uuuh... how you guys doin'? His voice echoes metallically in the strange chamber.  So laps of water from the 'walls'. In the air a pattern of glowing lines appears, a series o what appears to be circuit diagrams.  Bud staggers back f this strange 'screen' hanging in mid-air.  The image is a twenty feet across. There is a rolling jumble of static and interference whic resolves into...  the face of Dan Rather, doing the eveni news.  STATIC, then another newscast.  And another.  Frag of the same story.  The world on the brink of war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch our TV?  That what you're  trying to say?  That you know what's  been going on up there? The NTIs are impassive.  Static... then another newscast. This time, we're allowed to focus on the story.  An on-th scene interview outside a high-tech seismology lab.  Ther is an air of hysteria about the scene... technicians runn across the background of the shot, people shouting, the  reporter jamming his mike at the harried-looking scientis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a Caltech scientist who is among  those reporting an unprecedented  disturbance in the world's oceans.   Dr. Breg, can you give us a clearer  explanation then we're getting? Berg is edgy and distracted.  People keeps handing him pi of paper, computer hardcopy.  The biggest thing in his li is happening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're acoustic shockwaves, like  tsunamis, but with no seismological  source.  The waves are propagating  toward the shorelines of every  continent-- An assistant runs up, face shiny with fear, beckoning.  W see that Berg is running scared.  The impossible bringing the greatest terror to the rational mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'll be right there... I have  to go.  Look, we don't know what it  is!  Okay?  Not the slightest goddamn  idea! The image dissolves into static, fades out.  Bud turns to the NTIs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing it!  Right?  That's  what you're telling me.  Yeah, you  can control water...  that's your  technology.  But why? Static again, then a brilliant flash.  Grainy stock film a hydrogen bomb test in the Pacific. The film repeats, and then again, faster, and again until merges into an unbroken white glare.  Bud gets the messag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you don't know they're really  gonna do it.  Where do you get off  passing judgment on us, when you  can't be sure?  How do you know? The screen exploded into a staccato series of searing ima stark moments from recent history... US soldiers fighting in Vietnam, street warfare in Beirut car bomb in Belfast, a suspect shot in the head in the st of Saigon, burned and bleeding children, grainy footage o corpses bulldozed into mass graves at Auschwitz, Wermacht soldiers marching in goose-step review, a 13-year-old con with an AK-47...  Just glimpses, strobing... a few frames each. But enough.  The images continue.
HOLD ON BUD, as the lights flicker on his face, the ongoi indictment of humanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A video news crew leaps from a Jet Ranger helicopter in a parking area and runs to set up near the railing, facing ocean.  Pandemonium reigns around them, people running,  driving, evacuating inland. On the horizon, out to sea, a dark line has appeared. It grows in height as it comes closer, a wall of water  stretching across the horizon, already hundreds of feet h and growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG LENS SHOT, looking seaward past the Statue of Libert out past the Verazzano Narrows.  Stacked up by perspectiv the distant wave is a wall of water impossibly high, stil miles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene repeats on the eastern coast of the Kamchatka  Penninsula in Russia, where a full moon shimmers along th crest of a vast wave. SIRENS wail as Russian sailors run from the docks of  Petropavlovsk Naval Base. Some stand rooted as the black glacier of water, a thousa feet high and growing, thunders toward them in nightmaris slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minicam crew reporter is speaking rapidly, faltering  with emotion, his voice cracking like the famous broadcas from the scene of the Hindenburg disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horizon has gone dark... the  crowd is starting to run... some are  just staring, unable to move... the  wave... the wave is... it's... I  don't know... maybe a thousand feet  high already... getting bigger as  I'm watching...  still miles out...  oh my God, Jesus... I can hear it...

A roar fills the air, a thunder which drowns out the peop screams, even the rotors of the news chopper as the camer teams scrambles aboard.  They leave the announcer standin transfixed, his face blank, eyes tracking upward and upwa as the ground begins to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Statue of Liberty looks like a souvenir figurine at t afternoon sun is blocked out by the cresting tsunami, an  escarpment of water 2500 feet tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG LENS SHOT -- The Golden Gate Bridge and the hills of the city, the buildings downtown.  Beyond, FILLING FRAME the wall of sea green which defies our comprehension.  Th image shakes with the THUNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A diehard surfer looks over his shoulder as the mountain water which transcends his worst nightmare.  He lies para on his board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downtown Miami crouches in terror at the feet of the  shimmering monolith. In a penthouse office suite, an executive watches the wav towering above him, blocking out the sun, a line of ragin foam appearing as it arches over, about to break upon the teeming city. And then... The wave slows as it crests... And stops. IT SIMPLY STOPS. 2600 feet high and motionless except for a shimmering  undulation of its surface in the bright sun.  There is qu a faint wind and calling of confused gulls.  Various  reactions, as the thunder fades and people recover, only stand awed before the vast, inexplicable manifestation. news helicopter passes in front of it like a dragonfly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surfer just blinks, starting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the East Coast it's the same, as the World Trade Cente are dwarfed by a shimmering blue wall which stands... wai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russian seamen, lining the harbor breakwall at Petropavlo Naval Base on the Kamchatka Peninsula, stare upward at th monolith of water, undulating in the moonlight.  It seems poised to crash down, inflicting inconceivable devastatio but it doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When all have seen... The wave soundlessly subsides, slowly slipping back and d until the surface of the sea is normal again. VIDEO SHOT, HANDHELD, of a crowd of people watching the s Moving from face to face.  Various reactions as people re to what they can only understand as a miracle.  The faces awed, stunned, tear-streaked...  laughing.  The cameraman just walking.  Some people turn to him and smile, or laug or whoop. A woman is collapsed on a bench, crying. A man is on his knees, shaking. Total strangers hug each other. A black guy, tears pouring down his face, turns to the ca with a beautific grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody just laid it down to us,  man.  Things ain't never gonna be  the same! PULL BACK to reveal that we are in the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud sits, shaken, watching the screen, as people react to their deliverance. He turns to the NTIs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  You could've done it.  Why  didn't you?
The screen darkens.  Then letters appears on it, slowly  printing out, as if someone was clumsily typing them. WE KNEW THIS WAS... And we've seen this before so we know the rest...

dialogues.speaker: LOVE YOU WIFE
dialogues.text: The last message expands to fill the entire screen. Bud stares at the screen, at his message of self-sacrific then at the aliens.  They bow their heads, just for a mom A sign of respect. CLOSE ON BUD as he begins to realize what has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindsey is slumped in a chair, just staring.  Withdrawn. The others are conserving oxygen and heat, huddling in th dark. The air is looking pretty thick.  The speaker of the  hydrophone transceiver crackles to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deepcore, do you read?  This is  Benthic Explorer, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yes, we read!  Good of you to  join us.  How's that storm doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's strange... it just kind've  blew itself out all of the sudden.   We're up here in a flat sea with no  wind.  But then a lot of weird  things've been happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hell, son.  You better get us  a line down here, we're in moderately  poor shape.
LATER, Hippy, Catfish, and Monk are conferring B.G. on ho to get a new umbilical hooked on.  One Night is talking t McBride on the hydrophone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They figure it was over a half mile  high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could have seen it-- She glances down at the telemetry screen, seeing movement

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Hey!  HEY!!  Look... it's Bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible. Lindsey bolts to the screen.  Stares at the message print out. A huge grin wraps around her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it say? Lindsey take the mike and sits before the screen.  During the message, her voice will go through an emotional spect from confusion to wonder, to a childlike joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says...

dialogues.speaker: OF HAND LATELY"
dialogues.text: Lindsey grins as she reads the next part...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say that's a big 10-4, jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the windows the ocean is calm.  The sky steel-gray put placid.  McBride turns to Commodore DeMarco and the N contingent, his eyebrows cocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you boys might be out of  business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's going on down there.   I'm getting some big readings.... Bendix is hunched over the sonar, and we can see the scre lit up like a Wurlitzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Deepcore the crew becomes aware of a strange subsonic  rumbling.  The sonar is going crazy.  One Night puts the  headphones of her passive sonar rig up to her ear, then j it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew!  Whatever this is, it's major. The rumbling increases and a glow diffuses the water. The glow intensifies until a blinding shaft of light blas through the viewport, bathing the whole interior in a col white radiance. A last message appears on the screen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radiance intensifies.  Everyone covers their eyes.  I flares to WHITE-OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bendix and the bridge crew are going nuts.  All their  instruments are pegged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Active is pinging back something  big... it's enormous!  Coming up  right under us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?  EVERYWHERE!! (looks out the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there!  Port bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A depression appears in the surface of the sea a hundred  yards off, not swirling down like a whirlpool, just dimpl down. It gets wider.  Deeper.  Rapidly becomes a yawning pit. The ocean is OPENING. Now the surface is churned by turbulence.  Slow massive r of tremendous power boil up from the depths. McBride leads a mass exodus onto the deck to see better. The open becomes a roaring maw a hundred yards across. The ships are like toys on the shimmering rim of the  maelstrom. SOMETHING RISES IN THE CENTER OF THE OPENING.  A massive  spire.  Smoothly curving and iridescent.  Off the starboa beam, a quarter mile away, another spire rises.  Tons of  seawater fall from its sides with a THUNDEROUS ROAR, the  energy of Niagara. Off the port bow... another spire. And another, beyond the destroyer Albany, dwarfing it. Six towers... plus one larger, in the center.  Rising. One the Explorer's deck, a shadow engulfs them as the nea spire blocks out the sun.  The air, the sea, the deck... vibrate with the THUNDER OF CREATION. And now for the payoff shot:  WE'RE HIGH, LOOKING DOWN.

It surfaces with slow majesty, gently beaching all the sh on its broad back.  We recognize it as the structure into which Bud was led by the angelic being, which we assumed a city.  The Explorer rocks gently on its flat hull, clun massively to one side as it settles. The bridge crew watch millions of tons of seawater stream off the back of the vast, slightly curved hull.  The miss cruiser rocks back and forth nearby, high and dry... its  prop whining futility. ON EXPLORER'S DECK, McBride, Bendix, DeMarco, the rest of the Navy contingent... they're all standing there open- mouthed, in a dream-like daze.  Touched by the hand of Go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... WHAT THEY SEE -- Fifty yards away, between them and the  Albany, sits Deepcore Two.  It looks like a particularly  ugly and unwanted toy, sitting on the glistening plain of the NTI Ark's hull. CLOSER, ON TRIMODULE C, as the hatch at the bottom opens. Catfish's feet appear, bicycling.  He swings down to the  pearlescent 'deck'.  Stands there blinking in the sunligh mole-like.  Jammer plonks down behind him.  He turns, lif Lindsey down.  Hippy, Sonny, and the rest, emerge into th light of the sun.  A deliverance from the blackest night  they will ever know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be dead.  We didn't  decompress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out blood oughta be fizzin' like a  warm, shook-up Coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must've done something to us. Lindsey has tears streaming down her cheeks... for the su for life, for their deliverance and the larger one she kn has happened, an epiphany for the whole human race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.  I think you could say that. She blinks.  Seeing something not far away.  She gives a  little laugh, or something between laughing and crying.

REVERSE, as Bud walks up the curving incline of one of th mouth-like entrances to the NTI structure.  His suit is  casually unzipped and the FBS helmet dangles from one han jauntily. She starts toward him.  Breaks into a run.  Then stops a feet from him. Watching him come to her. His smile, his eyes illuminating her. He stops and she touches him, lightly.  Is this real? The look at each other, wonderingly a moment. Then laugh.  She sniffs loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Brigman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs. Brigman. Their lips meet.
